IrIHqxYKpZsuagm0dfPdRA.text: Flavia the owner is one of the nicest women on this planet. My wife and I have eaten her on many different occasions and never have been disappointed. Their chimmichuri sauce is to die for. Make sure to save room for dessert, the passion fruit mousse is Awesome. An the sangria... It's an absolute must. Make sure you make reservations here ASAP!

D6tkViAbq8Dcb4V1ymy-NA.text: I have been a couple of times to Green Forest.  The place is nice, people very friendly, service is good and the food is great and fresh.  Parmesan pork is amazing (just personal taste :) ).  I have been to several other churrascarias (one in Brazil too) and I would say that it is really comparable.  The only thing it might be room for improvement is to bring a larger variety of meats (to justify also the fairly high price compared to other places with larger variety).

cr7J3fepxpmgF5DmsxC6Sg.text: Good place and good food overall.  Need to update the decor.

C05FuWQCFssLTID2MC0tng.text: This place is pretty awesome in theory.  There is a non-stop flood of rare meats, and an endless buffet of bleeding awesome.  At some point, they paraded a cow through the room and people just bit it.  He was a dignified cow, with the stoic demeanor of an old John Wayne.  I watched as he was slowly eaten away to a skeleton.  A bitter tear slid down my cheek as I lamented my bovine friend.  I turned the red/green thingy to red to give him a moment of silence...then turned it back to green and ate some different type of meat.  I left when they walked the live turkey through the room.  Uh, but yeah, this place is a pretty good experience in general, the staff is good, the food is delicious.  There can be a moment of sticker shock when the bill comes, but this place works best as an informal special event type of place.  All in all, a pretty fun experience.

ZQ_U5pjnAkydvjIZaeYQEQ.text: Went here a while back for my college graduation with a few friends.  There's definitely a better ambiance if you go for dinner vs. lunch, but I was satisfied every time I was there.  Service was very friendly and outgoing, even when I went with a large group, and the meat was always succulent and juicy.  I'm surprised that people are complaining about the price.  I can tell you that at other churrascarias around the country you can expect to pay 40-75% more for the same meal.  And I feel that the Green Forest just seems to have a better atmosphere and better tasting meet than chains such as Fogo de Chao.  I can only hope to compare my experiences there with churrascarias in Brazil if/when I go for business travel.

QetfDz3RQ3LOWVkR38i-ng.text: Green Forest is a Brazilian churrascaria - a rodizio restaurant. The idea is a fixed price menu for as much meat as you can eat. They bring out flank steak, top sirloin, bacon wrapped filet mignon, pork loin, chicken, chicken hearts, Brazilian sausage, beef rib, and other meat and cut it and put it on your plate.   They also have a warm buffet with rice, beans, fish, and pasta. Their cold buffet has shrimp, salad, mussels, clams, ahi tuna, artichoke hearts, cheese, salami type meats, and a bunch of other food. It's not a vegetarian friendly place.  I think this restaurant has some 5 star qualities, and some 2 star qualities. The restaurant's atmosphere isn't great: they no longer have a liquor license, it's in an office park, the ceiling tiles aren't immaculate. But the meat is excellent - and there's really nowhere else you can get this much meat and have it be so good. Bring a big stomach, and your wallet. It's not cheap ($26.95 + drinks, tax, and tip), but it's fun to do once a year.

pkLk2zO1jwI-3XJXsutEcQ.text: Come hungry and loosen your belt for this meatfest!  Food was excellent, service was quick.  Came on a Saturday evening and spent $37.50 on the main meal; drinks and desserts extra.  Plan on spending $100 + tip for a party of two.  Would I do it again?  Count me in!

qFR3PsOWExMIDAY4pIfIFw.text: Good service ,great meats.  If you've never done Churrascaria,this is a great place to start.  Saturday nights are crowded,but the variety of meats is larger,including suckling baby pig.  I've eaten at quite a few of these places and believe it or not,this is one of the best in the US.

288uFwEw-zGV4Ee6az8VQA.text: My first time at this type of Brazilian restaurant, but i am sure that it will not be my last. As previous posts indicate, it will really cater to meat lovers, and those with large appetites. As many have stated, it is rather pricey, but really not bad if you eat a lot, and especially for the quality of food. Desserts and drinks are not included, but it is BYOB. Many different beef, some sausage, chicken and a few lamb. The lamb was excellent, and the parmesian beef (tenderloin, I think) was suprising tasty and tender. Their salad bar is underrated, I think, as most come for the meat. It has nice olives (including red olives), seafood salads, some tuna and salmon sashimi, cured meats (I think decent prosciutto, salami, and sopressata) among others. The black beans were also good - very smoky flavor. I have now been here twice, and my second visit was better than the first. The meats were all cooked medium rare (with some a little more on the rare side), while at my first visit a few were well done. The parmesan steak was wonderful both times - the parmesan flavor really comes through, much more than one would think. The flank steak was very tender, and the filet had a great crust on it. My piece was half crust, and it was awesome. The leg of lamb had quite a gamey flavor/grass fed flavor - which I love. The lamb chop was also great.

-e4zX-RTGfZTfJaAfO663w.text: Nice dinning environment, friendly staff. Everything is delicious except that the steak there was kinda salty..

ZXfvCmEiCyWv6oP88RBL_Q.text: I went here for Valentine's Day a few years back with a girl I (unfortunately) had no chance with. No matter! The food was fantastic. There's nothing quite like unlimited amounts of meat (and generally, just meat) being brought to you at the flip of a button (green means give me meat, red means you're lagging behind). There's a pretty nice salad/buffet bar as well with plenty of choices for those who aren't up for eating three or four pounds of meat in a short amount of time. Delicious seasoning, great variety, nice atmosphere!

udxOO5Gvf1rfy0TdDj3-EA.text: This isn't a restaurant, it's a food EXPERIENCE!  My friends warned me ahead of time, and I am thankful.  They said, "drink lots of water all day, but don't eat anything..."  They were right.  I have always been the carnivore's carnivore, but I must say, I have never eaten so many delicious meats in one meal as I had at the Green Forest.  I was READY for the meats.  What I WASN'T ready for was the vast array of other foods that were prepared and waiting on a monstrous ice bar and in hot chaffing dishes.  Bring your own beer or wine, and prepare for the food experience of a lifetime!  When they ask you if you want dessert, just laugh and try to burp.  (You'll probably be too full to do EITHER!)  Amazingly enough, even after some of the best roasted meats I have ever tasted, my FAVORITE part was the brown sugar-encrusted spit-roasted pineapple!  Wow.  You might want to bring a dolly so somebody can wheel you out of there when you finally say uncle.

mlcn22yIxgaaoA5HzrUtTQ.text: This place was something I wasn't expecting.  The salad bar was amazing and had some great selections.  They brought around countless varieties of meats each one as good as the last.  Great place to take someone special out on a memorable evening.

GSPB8yOxeWBY9yAPeihOMg.text: I don't want to beat a dead horse, since pretty much everyone agrees that this place rocks!  I just want to add my 5 star review and say this is my absolute FAVORITE restaurant!  The servers are attentive and often entertaining.  Don't make any other plans for the evening if you are eating here, because if you are like me, you will quickly go into food coma after eating there.  I don't know where the other 6 deadly sins hang out, but I know where gluttony has taken up residence!

N_b2mlI5R6K-mw4nnAKzfw.text: We've eaten here several times over the years and have always enjoyed it. This is not really a place you would patronize on a regular basis, but definitely the place to go when you find yourself experiencing that deep, inchoate desire to indulge your carnivorous cravings. An excellent destination for lapsed vegetarians to get back in touch with their authentic self.  Green Forest serves a wonderful variety of grilled meats and has a very nice buffet with good quality seafood and sides. You need to bring your own wine (or beer). And you do want to plan for a leisurely meal; all that meat is heavy going, so give yourself a chance to sample your way through the full rotation. Including the grilled pineapple. Yum. At the end, if you still have room or inclination, do check out their dessert offerings. A sherbet goes down quite nicely at that point.  The service has always been great; nice people and with a sense of humor.

yiWRtaoUvx7_i12GGcQ4aQ.text: I have not tried the Brazilian steak houses in Chicago as their prices seem a bit hight for my budget.  But at $28.80 a person, this place was in range.  The meat variety was very large and of very high quality and the appetizer and salad bar contained some excellent offerings, especially the shrimp and the grilled mushrooms.  Skip the hot side dishes unless you want to fill up on starch.  As per the other reviewer, location is a bit strange and decor is plain.  Service was outgoing and very friendly.

lkCbpz-3pW8mppYp-ndOYA.text: meat meat beautifully meat . 16 different kinds of meat cooked over a charcoal fire .the cold bar has ever thing from crab to suisi..go for dinner and skip lunch that day your going to need the room for all the great food. the servace is second to none the meat runners are all ways around never have to wait for more meat.

xbHIJ2_4dzm7B5qmTzXzxA.text: Unlimited steak, unlimited oysters. This place beats Texas de Brazil and Fogo de Chao on almost everything, the quality is exceptional. Come in hungry and pace yourself. The toilet is near the entrance in case you need to free up some space.

bjPiwugZYoLdwVgeoFSrPg.text: Hauled my tukas all the way out to Monroeville for a girls night out with two lovely Brazilian women and it was well worth the drive. The meats were perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious. They're not fancy, but the warm welcome, attentive service and excellent caipirinhas more than make up for that. I ate myself silly and enjoyed every bite. Their sides and salad bar had lots of super yummy things to eat. Everything is made fresh on site including the desserts. My fave was the passion fruit mousse. Tart, sweet and perfect after all that red meat. I would highly recommend it.

pBwQtEsujD8orvy3LyX70g.text: This was an amazing experience. The food was never ending and incredible. The staff were very nice. If you love high quality meats and cheeses. This place is well worth the money

UvgbZQ2jUrPgWikJyiONKg.text: Love this place.  Unexpected quality in a hard to find, obscure spot.  Fabulous salad bar and of course all the meat you can eat.  Go hungry.

kCWjbvh4kLyLZqIPRY_ufQ.text: I typically avoid meat and all-you-can-eat restaurants. So it was with trepidation that I tagged along for a family birthday celebration at the Forest Churrascaria. My expectations lowered further when I saw that the restaurant was "out by Monroeville" (actually Penn Hills). My heart sank as we pulled up to a semi-abandoned 5-6 story corporate buildings tucked behind a tattered 1960's strip center. My only hope was that the YELP reviews I had read would be True (nearly 5 star average). The inside of the restaurant was nothing special but pleasant enough (corporate cafeteria circa 1990) and clean. Let me just cut to the chase and say that the quality of the food was fabulous. I did not do the "meat" version of the menu but had the hot food and "salad bar" option. Everything I had was super fresh and of high quality: traditional Brazilian bean stew with melt-in-your-mouth chunks of meat, a seafood stew, shrimp cocktail, a cheese and bread bar, and much more! The cuts of meat that were brought over for my tablemates looked lean and delicious (parmesan filet mignon, lamb, skirt steaks, top sirloin in madeira sauce, rib eye). But beyond the remarkable food was the service. The lovely host and our server deserve 6 out of 5 stars. They explained everything, checked in just the right amount of times, and answered all our questions and filled our requests with speed, accuracy, and graciousness. I can't recommend this place enough!

ROFZjIFv7OLcq4EFBTg7EA.text: Yea the decor isn't the best and dinner can be a lil pricy but 2 words: Parmesan filet. I think I was on the verge of passing out from over-eating but I had to eat it again. Service was great and you don't wait long before more meat comes. In fact, every few mins we had to turn our card to "red" which tells servers to pump the brakes on bringing us more meat!  Don't waste your appetite on the appetizers. You get to choose 2 from a list and they're not that good. Parking is easy and free in their own lot.   Lastly, wear loose sweat pants and a headband.

zAZS4cMi2MJ0eJs5SA9O2w.text: The restaurant staff are second to none You will be served by a staff that is dedicated, attentive, courteous and knowledgeable about the operation. SO refreshing to experience this level of service.  And the food ?  Fantastic! Price? Let me just say this:  Well worth it considering the quality and variety of foods coupled with unparalleled service.

YKaVtKcGQhct7mzydh_eQA.text: This restaurant is the PERFECT example of what a Real Brazilian Steakouse should consist of. Quality meats, quality service. Absolutely my favorite place for great meat in Pittsburgh! Everyone should try!!!

tKnXIbml5OrcYyWsij0-5Q.text: First visit was great. The meats were excellent and the salad bar and sides were fresh. This was several months ago.   I returned recently and it seemed like everything was in a sharp decline across the board. The salad bar quality was mediocre. It was very hard to enjoy the meats because the vast majority of them tasted as if they have been sitting in a tub of salt all night. The meats were so salty I'm pretty sure I was hypertensive for the next few days.

lIdCBBQWaOHS4QjQ3wTR6A.text: This place was lots of fun for our son's birthday.  It's a meat coma just waiting for you.  You know what you're getting in to here.  So anyone complaining about the price should be ignored.  It's going to be expensive. But, it's fun with lots and lots of meats.  Full bar too.

-nIUiaEZwxp5BWXGLsO0ow.text: I ate here on New Year's Eve for the second New Year's Eve in a row.  The decor of the restaurant is nice upon entering but is not nearly as nice in the seating area.  Regardless of that both the bar and buffet are impressive.  I started off by going up to the cold bar which had a wonderful selection of different foods.  It contained everything from savory meats and fresh Parmesan cheese to crab legs and even some sushi and sashimi.  Honestly, I could have been happy with just eating from the buffet the whole night but the best was yet to come.  If you have ever been to a  Brazilian steakhouse before then you know the ridiculous selection of meats that they have.  Everything that they brought out seemed to be cooked perfectly with my favorites being the skirt steak and the Parmesan encrusted filet.  The meat servers were also very much on the ball and new meats were arriving at the table almost every minute that I had my card turned to green.  Overall it was probably the best experience I have had here and I have never had one that was not pleasurable.  The bottom line is that this is the only Brazilian steakhouse in Pittsburgh which is ok because it is a good one and I will definitely be back in the future.  Don't expect to get off cheap when eating here but it is still well worth the price for all of the wonderful cuts of meat that they have.

Wnw-fk7NI000urnDwVxBIw.text: Decided to check this joint out when they launched a group deal.  Never had been to a Churrascaria and it was on my list, so why not?  Went for an early dinner and the dinning room was about 1/4 full.  Not sure how this translates into food quality (read turnover time), but all of the meats were great.  The two lamb preparations had a perfect level of salty, crispy, crunchy char that left me craving more and overeating until I felt like the blueberry girl from Charlie and the Chocolate Factory.  I second others' comments in that the cold salad bar is definitely worth skipping.  Nothing I ran across impressed and it just stole away precious real estate from more meat.  Two things lowered this to a 3-star review.  1.)  The price.  While I enjoyed dinning here with the substantial discount, I could never bring myself to pay $40+ for this meal in the future.  2.)  The dessert.  Our waiter brought around a dessert tray with a variety of items and asked which one we would want.  The combination of how they asked, the tone of their voice, and the way they presented the option made it sound like it was included in the meal...  well they managed to fool an entire table of 6 otherwise.  ~$10 for an extremely bland piece of cheesecake left me feeling cheated and deflated after what was a fantastic foray into meat gluttony.  Pay attention to the fine print, open up your wallet, and its definitely an experience worth trying ONCE.

4MWAGKTN9XdG-BY8vdohKg.text: Let me start by saying I have been here 7 times in 18 months. The first 3 times were amazing but it has been on a steady decline for months now. Two visits ago myself and family didn't have the best experience with undercooked and under flavored meat. Last visit prior to last night we had the same problem with old portions in the cold bar and no standard pallet cleansers to go with the meal. Last night we decided to go and give it another shot. It was the most disappointing experience we've had regarding food quality in a long time. While the waitress service was relatively good, the food was TERRIBLE. I can usually handle a medium to medium rare steak as long as it's seasoned right. Even after requesting it be more medium than rare, they still produced undercooked and extremely under seasoned meat. At one point, blood was sprayed on the shirt as the meat was being cut.   Other parts of the experience: 1. Old Italian meats on the boards, to a point of being crusted around the edges.  2. It took 30 minutes before we saw the first filet cut come around (and it was nearly rare). Quite upsetting. Not nearly as upsetting as the undercooked pork loin that came out though.   3. We saw 5 meat selections for the first 30 minutes including only shot at the picahna (supposed to be the specialty). Out of these other 4, chicken wings, sausage, beef rib, sirloin. Only one steak regularly came through, and it was the lowest quality. While the selection picked up after that the quality stayed the same.  4.  Previous visits also included grilled pineapple, but again, it seems to have disappeared off the selection list.   I thought maybe this was just a bad night, but when I consider the last three visits I have to believe that this place has dropped its standards it once lived up to. It was mine and my daughter's favorite place to eat but she was also not happy with the quality last night.   I hate to say it, but we won't be back. We have never had a bad experience at Texas de Brazil, so we will drive the extra distance to go there from now on.    This place should be better, because it HAS been better.

mCAsCMx_ji_mdhkrcgUEtg.text: Fantastic!  Various assorted meats: Amazing  Salad Bar / Side Dish Bar : Pretty Good, nothing to complain about  Deserts: I don't know how we still had room, but they were great.  Customer Service: Awesome  The price is a little steep, but you are really getting a lot for the price. This is a great little gem, and I can't wait to go back. Also this is a great place for a large party, we went in with 12-15 people (with a res of course) and they were super accommodating, everyone was very impressed with the great service. It was also a bit more fun than a regular restaurant for a large party.  Just remember, this is a meat marathon, not a sprint.

Wp98icccrLxwp1NLmjejyg.text: This is our favorite "treat" restaurant.  It'll be $100 for the two of us, but worth every penny!    Starting with the Green Forest caipirinha.  THE BEST!  If you think you're going get one similar anywhere else, you're not.  Try it here.  Every meat you can imagine - I prefer rare, must hubby prefers well.  We are both more than satisfied.  The grill masters have perfected the spices and you will more than satisfy your carnivorous cravings.  When the place isn't packed, which is not so often of late, the carvers will cater to your favorites - otherwise it's a constant circuit of various offerings, great variety.  My husband always goes to the hot bar...  black beans (fabulous), white rice, potatoes, soup and fish...  he's a meat-and-potatoes guy.  'Nuff said.  Now for my favorite:  the cold bar.  Marinated portabella mushrooms, asparagus, seafood salad, sushi, lox, crab legs, shrimp, seaweed salad, oysters, feta salad, olives, beets.  There is also a bread station with an enormous block of parmasean cheese.  The meat is wonderful, but this area keeps my attention - these are the things I don't often get and are what really makes this one of my favorite places!  Carrot cake?  Mile high and loaded with pistachios - we always split.  Galliano?  Finally tried it one evening - great after meal instead of dessert.    Like I said - this is our "treat" restaurant.  We have not been disappointed in the several years we have been patrons - you won't be either!

FZ460t1D4aEMeQvk91WQYA.text: Great restaurant! Food and meat are all very good! Although I didn't recognize every piece of meat I had, they were all delicious with different flavor. The buffet was good, too! Salmon, shrimp, salad, cheese, ham, everything was excellent. The passionate fruit mousse was tasty! Staffs are friendly and polite. Will go again.

tI89JBp7SlXz5dNL5j793w.text: Maybe I was taken a bit off-guard when I was first introduced to the concept of a Brazilian steakhouse. I'm an Asian kid from Queens, so sue me. At best, I've had Korean barbeque (the marinate they use for that stuff is godly) and the basic cuts they have at your local outback steakhouse(I don't profess to be a fine dining guru).  Imagine my surprise, and my blissful joy when I learned of the never-ending carousel of meats that is Green Forest Churrascaria.  So first thing's first: THE MEATS, Green Forest Churrascaria is nothing without its meats. Sure they have a decent selection of side dishes and anti-pastis to pair with their never ending grind of quality meats. But it does not compare with the variety of cuts, filet Mignons, top sirloins, and tenderloins that their waiters sprint to and from the kitchen with. My experience here was top-notch, as I took the (very wise) advice of my friend to fast the entire day before my meal. I decided to run through the entire merry go-round of meats before I went for any seconds.   My personal advice? If you're a quality meats kind of guy, you'll stay away from some of the lower cuts, (especially anything wrapped with bacon. I know you're going to complain but hear me out first). SAVE SPACE for the quality, I'm talking about the filet-mignon and the pork ribs. These cuts have that melt-off-the-bone quality that I imagine high-class establishments would have (If I'd ever been to one). Most of the steaks they serve are packed full of rich savory flavor, and have no need of any kind of sauce or cheese. Let your personal taste dictate your preference. My recommendation is to space out your nonstop meat binges with sprinkles of cinnamon pineapple slices and the occasional green to keep your palate oiled, and your gut going strong.  If I were not a lowly college senior, I'd dine in Brazillean cutlet heaven every night. But the sad truth is that I live on a budget. So naturally, price is my biggest complaint about this establishment. But given the amount of meat you receive, and the lack of limitations to the cuts that you'll eat here, I don't think any of you will gripe too much over the cost. For the Pittsburgh local who loves his/her meats, give it a shot. I guarantee you wont regret it.

e4YZnRoKxpAVL0OCkaE0Yw.text: I have been to more than 10 Brazilian steakhouses all over the country, this is by far the best one ever. Based on my experience, this place is better than the most famous franchises (without mentioning any names) . It is a family owned restaurant with real Brazilian people. We just missed  skirt steak .

TwRvtU34OR5HT8whZbMAAw.text: Best Brazilian restaurant in the burgh. Very nice wait staff. Food is delicious and you don't have to wait for the next round. This is a continuous stream of meat. Yummmmmmmm

FeT9hqvfQ3f_9XT1xsh4Fg.text: I've been going here for years. I can't believe I now get around to leave a review.  Green Forest is a Brazilian restaurant that cooks meats the same way and is the closest thing to Argentinean asado. You wont need to add any sauces or spices to their meats.  I no longer eat red meat but my husband does, he's been to Argentina and he loves a good churrasco or asado so imagine how exited he gets when we get to go to Green Forest.  As for me, I've been a pescatarian for six years. Their salad bar is FANTASTIC. **Vegetarians, or vegans: they have everything and anything you can think of. **  I'm sure you already read somewhere here about the red and green coasters (or wood pieces) they have on each table to let the servers know if you're ready for more meat.  Don't forget to try their succulent deserts, their flan is my favorite.

ZHcvaMhlysWlTOgvRCmgIw.text: Good food, but definitely not the best meat I've eaten. Wife loves the grilled zucchini, and the squid in the hot bar is very tasty. I like how attentive the people are in the restaurant, but when the bill came I realized that the dessert and coke were both additional and they were pretty overpriced (3.75 for a coke). Overall? Lots of meat and not a bad meal at all, but not worth the money we spent :(

h5CCEGr1vhX2S7_k_dp89Q.text: I like so much that I want go back again. Just two things that I didn't like: - the smoke inside the restaurant (because of the barbecue) - the fact that they don't have cheese bread (pao de queijo) that is mandatory to have in any brazilian restaurant (in my opinion).  But the food and service is really nice!!!! I love it.

Y0ebvCrr4qDRiCz115Fvhg.text: Never order from here, I ordered from Uber eats A fillet mignon & it was flat as hell. Basically as thin as a piece of paper almost threw up at work. Nothing more disappointing than being excited to eat a nice juicy steak and it showing up to be shit. Sad.

photos.caption: Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This is not a GOD DAMN FILET MIGNON.  Efffff that

giIja4p4k3gq8LZYqx5dYg.text: Good service, good meat, kind of expensive. For that price they should included desert but nope, you gotta pay extra for dersert so probably my first and last time here.

rQZ1ZidRdsGBqxzSEjV2ZA.text: Not sure how many times I've been here but can't stop coming back! Meats are always top notch and cooked to perfection. Salad bar alone is enough for a meal in itself. Worth every penny!!!

s0xr6-S4AcD4Ln_R_ek59A.text: Fun & delicious experience! The atmosphere was casual & relaxed. Our waitress, Nicole, was very knowledgeable, patient, and helpful for our first time dining. The meat servers were also all very friendly. The food was delicious & for everything that's included, you can't beat the price! There were a lot more meat options than we had initially expected, so my advice is to make sure you've tried everything before accepting seconds, otherwise you fill up fast! Try the guarana soda & be sure to save room for dessert- the french press coffee & chocolate truffles are amazing.

DJznqGYFFLg-arc1-8O71Q.text: Lots of meat :) The variety of meats were very good and the buffet had good sides that could go with the meat as well as sushi, oysters,... While I recommend the food, the dessert was disappointing. And they charge extra for dessert. We tried the cheesecake and flam and none of them were good.

i__MjRYz_C9ujLEDQ8jrvw.text: Im not much of a carnivore but my hubby of course loves meat. I decided to try this place after a neighbor suggested it. They have a small buffet that consist of brazilian style side dishes along with some italian and asian favorites.  The interior has a calm intimate setting with plenty of seating enough for a party if you needed it to be. The server greets you immediately and if you're a new comer as we were they inform you of what Churrascaria is and they bring out these tasty appetizers for your table even though you have a whole buffet and delicious meats waiting for you.   We ordered a brazillian beer called Xingu which is dark like a lager but smooth like a light beer. We loved it! the appetizers were like a fried banana, some kind of potato and even their version of what i would call cheese sticks only it was bread with melted mozzarella cheese inside. great!!  So they give you this wooden coaster that has a red and green side to it to inform them that you want them to bring meat to the table. Green for go; Red for stop. whatever you do don't leave the green side up cause that means they will keep bringing meat stick after stick. The best part is that there are over 20 different varieties of delectable juicy meats to choose from. Prime rib, bacon wrapped filet mignon and chicken and turkey for the non red meat eaters.  The salad bar was still my favorite because of all the exotic treats they had. Everything that i'd want in a salad they had it. Even sushi, mussles, ray oysters, crab legs, breads with olive and fresh olives, garlic and plenty of other fine toppings. Home made dressing and even hot sides like rice, scallop potatoes, seafood melody and 2 kinds of soup. It was amazing the choices they had and i would honestly suggest staring for a few days before going here. it's about $40 a person without drinks so whenever you go make sure you get your moneys worth!!

Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brazilian beer
Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dining room

kULpLEffRiN93__3-062nw.text: Horrible experience... the guy who carried the meat was very rude. Won't go back again! He yelled loudly and used his knife knocking my tong from his meat just because I did not pull the meat off properly. He even said "you're gonna make my meat looks bad!" Are you kidding me! Make it look perfect for yourself!

ae0IlsVfkeYRrHdj8cSJYA.text: Wonderful server (Anthony and he is the shit!) if you can get him.   The ONLY thing I'd want to be better is the thermostat to be turned up just a little more...was a bit chilly.

_YHxzzD5ZCf46MUDxL8OAA.text: Don't have a cow.  Unless you are at Green Forest Churrascaria, because this place is mainly about one thing--the MEAT.  The waiters brought out some of the most succulent, tasty meat that I've had including (* indicates a fav)-- beef ribs, flank steak, top sirloin, rib eye, leg of lamb*, brazilian sausage, beef tenderloin, filet mignon w parmesan cheese, skirt steak, baconn wrapped filet, bbq pork ribs*, beef tenderloin swordfish w passion fruit sauce, and pineapple with cinnamon* (not a meat, but it comes out on a skewer).  The APPETIZERS were also delicious--  fried banana*, fried yuka, and cheese bread.    However, the SALAD BUFFET was not good. The food looked like it had been sitting there for hours and people there barely touched it.  Don't bring vegetarians--they'll only veg!   It's $40.50 for the meat, appetizers and salad bar.

fJlWcfKj1IQD5IHSNFM8Zw.text: I've been to Brazilian stake houses around the country and this is my now my all time favorite. Definitely better food and service than Fogo de Chao.  The salad bar has nicer options, the staff are more pleasant, the meats are tastier, everything is first rate.  I have been to places that had fancier decor and more exotic atmosphere, but I'll happily trade that little bit of flair for superior food and friendlier service.  The location is great, very easy to get to and free parking, but you cannot see it from the road so you have to turn into the plaza and head to the back left building to find it on the ground floor of an office building.

Rzt8OUIzKEgHPGLMHO-0aA.text: I had a rough time deciding how to review Green Forest. It has some amazing pros... but some pretty terrible cons at the same time. Let's just say that Green Forest is lucky that a Fogo de Chao hasn't opened in Pittsburgh. Otherwise, I'm pretty sure Green Forest would be out of business.  The hubby and I dined at Green Forest for the first time on Friday night with a large party. First impressions were a little rough. The restaurant is located in an office complex-type building. While trying to figure out where we were going, I felt like we were headed for either the dentist or to apply for a home loan.  The interior was even worse than the exterior. It was dark and dreary, circa 1994. The bar was very dated, and an adjacent "living room" area was cluttered with firewood and random stuff. Unfortunately, I had to go to the bathroom a couple of times over the four hours that we drank and dined there. The bathrooms were located down a creepy, medical-style corridor and were in terrible shape for a restaurant that charges $40 per plate.   The salad bar area seemed a little arbitrary to me. I would have enjoyed more options for a lettuce salad and traditional sides (say, potatoes or pasta) as opposed to the assorted offerings of soup, sides, cheese, sushi, pasta salads, etc. I tried a strange side that looked deliciously cheesy and saucy... until I realized that fish was part of the concoction, too. I was also challenged by the fact that there were only tiny bowls at the salad bar as opposed to full sized plates. It really limited the amount of things that I was able to get at one time.  However, despite being disappointed by the salad bar, I was not disappointed by the meat! Wow, the meat was incredible!! This was the one area of the restaurant that I thought was better than its Fogo de Chao competition. Most of the Green Forest meats were cooked rare or medium rare, which I absolutely love. However, a friend of ours barely ate any of the beef options because they were practically mooing, as I like to say. Of course, the major disadvantage of cooking the meat so rare is alienating some of the customers.  Finally, customer service was excellent compared to most restaurants, but not as amazing for a Brazilian restaurant. I don't think there were enough employees walking the meats around, and I only saw a few of my favorite cuts a couple times. I was also never so overwhelmed by meat that I had to turn my card over to "No." And yes, being overwhelmed is a great feeling in a Brazilian restaurant!  My recommendation to customers would be to check out this restaurant if you've never eaten at a Brazilian place before. My recommendation to the owners would be to upgrade the decor to take them from a 3 star to a 4 star establishment.

E67Zvp3wHDCxyTSMWA6rHA.text: Green Forest is a special occasions restaurant. At least, if either your budget or your penchant for overeating delicious meats isn't unbound. I've been there several times; I'd go back any time someone else was paying. And maybe if I was paying, once a year. The meats are cooked well and they have a nice assortment; the accompanying salad/seafood bar is also pretty high quality.

HZMui6wqJm_o4H9yXM0fbA.text: I haven't been to this establishment since 2010 and a friend of mine wanted to celebrate his birthday here so we went! First of all it is pricy around $44.50 per person if you get the full salad bar, hot plates, and meat. They do though have other options and a bar menu which I didn't really look over. They did have a nice drink/ wine selection that was a bit to over priced for me but my guest did enjoy 2 of there signature drinks which was a Caipirinha for 9 bucks a pop. The ambiance was nice it was very quite and mellow with interesting decor.  Now as for the food it was excellent except for a few things but that was personal preference to taste. As for salads they had a sea weed salad, mixed green salad, and caesar salad. I had some of the Caesar salad which was good and a ton of seafood. I even tried there octopus which I never had and it was delicious. The hot bar had some kind of fish stew which was ok and a few other things I really wasn't interested in. They also had a little side table with meats and salamis along with a decent cheese selection which was to die for. I love garlic and they had these whole roasted fatal if cloves marinated in some Rosemary marinade that I swear I could of ate the whole bowl!  As for the grilled meats you flip a little coaster red means stop and green means bring on the meat! Some of the meats were fantastic but some were not for me which came back to my taste. They were cooked perfectly and they did ask how you wanted stuff cooked too. Over all I loved the experience I would come here again but probably tweak the menu to my liking probably just stick with the salad bar since I'm a seafood lover. My biggest downfall was they DO NOT label all the foods and I didn't know what I was eating half the time and had to guess. Wish they would label stuff

sL-6lJg7Pt9Q89h0WGlN8Q.text: I am really disappointed that they don't have sushi on the bar anymore. This was my favorite restaurant because of that.

683B3FAsFOVIezFGEhGBhw.text: This place has always been consistent with service, quality and cleanliness. We went in about 7:30 on a Wednesday during restaurant week without a reservation and we were seated right away.( I still recommend reservations during that week but I knew we were going on a later side) They said they had 20 people waiting out the door when they opened at the door. The staff always very friendly and helpful, all done with love!

h2NBXpU6YyveVehrDM8HoA.text: My wife and I went there for our anniversary and it was fantastic! I've been to a Churrascaria before and the salad bar selection was very limited and the meats have been horribly overcooked. Not so here! The cold bar had dried meats, cheeses, cold salads and fish. Everything I tried was delicious.   The meats were fantastic, as well. They were perfectly cooked and tasted amazing. Some were parmesean crusted, another marinated in some sort of pesto. Even the chicken, which often is horribly overcooked, was amazing. We had lamb, beef, turkey wrapped in bacon, and chicken.   The service deserves a mention. The host let us try a taste of wine before committing to a whole bottle of it. We missed the chicken so the gentleman went into the kitchen and returned in about 5 minutes with a skewer of it.   It's a bit pricey, but about the same as I've seen other at similar restaurants. For all you can eat, I think it was a fair price. We have family coming to town later this month and we absolutely plan to take them here!

PrOlWRjGNbBFAP8RFhawwg.text: After years of being guilty of "judging a book by its cover," I finally caved and gave Green Forest a try. I thought, "there's absolutely no way a Brazilian churrascaria in an old business park in Monroeville is going to be good!" Well, I was completely wrong.  Yeah, the small business park vibe, old building, and outdated decor paints an odd picture, but the food more than makes up for how far the first impression may set you back. The staff is wonderful, attentive, and very, VERY nice. In fact, once we told our server that one of the girls in our group was pregnant, they took extra care to make sure they brought her the fully-cooked pieces of meat (even going so far as to bring around a smaller table-side skillet to finish cooking her pieces while serving the rest of us.   As for the food...we didn't really keep count on our first visit, but we counted EIGHTEEN different meat offerings the second time around: rotisserie chicken, ribeye, Brazilian sausage, top sirloin, flank, sirloin with chimichurri, picanha, parmesan filet mignon, thick-cut bacon, pork tenderloin, leg of lamb, turkey wrapped in bacon, lamb chops, bacon-wrapped filet, beef rib, baby back ribs, beef tenderloin, and filet topped with a mushroom wine sauce. Our previous trip also included a garlic-infused sirloin that was incredible. Overall, the meats - while salty in their own right - don't hit the overwhelming sodium levels that you get at some churrascarias. I ate nearly every cut of meat (most two or three times, actually), and left there feeling full, but not bloated and miserable. Of course, part of that may have come down to the fact that we got there right when the restaurant opened both times. In both cases, we barely had enough time to explore the salad bar before the meat began making its rounds, which means we didn't fill up on the salad bar items. In fact, both times, I never even took a second look at the salad bar because the meat came around so fast and so frequently that all other items were quickly forgotten.  When thinking about the sides and desserts, I wasn't in love with their pao de queijo, but that doesn't mean it's not good. (also, meant that I didn't fill up on bread!). Also, the fried yuca and bananas are quite yummy. You'll need to ask for those items, though, as they don't automatically bring them out to you. Dessert isn't included in the price, and while decent and made in-house, I wouldn't recommend the tiramisu unless you really enjoy a liquor flavor. I found it quite strong in my serving. Perhaps a heavy hand, perhaps the norm...either way, I'd recommend having an extra cut of meat or two instead!  Now, while the salad bar and I didn't spend much time getting to know each other, I can say that Green Forest does put out a commendable assortment of offerings. You standard beans and rice, hearts of palm, cheeses and charcuterie are on display, as well as some sushi, lobster mashed potatoes, soups and salads, etc. I have no complaints about the salad bar, but let's be real here: If you're at a churrascuria, you're there to eat meat, and that's truly where Green Forest shines.  It's an unpretentious environment, with phenomenal service, excellent food, and reasonable prices. As people who live in the city, I can tell you that we are willing to drive the sometimes-torturous "short" distance to Green Forest instead of the 5-minute drive to Texas de Brazil any day of the week. It's definitely worth it! Enjoy!

DH-U7zwQClMTI382Z88Gzw.text: Terrible. Terrible. Terrible. Terrible. Food wasn't fresh. Place looked tacky. However the service was really good, hence the one star rating.

vPm6GX6Ze1DKUIvSO-XyrA.text: I have eaten here about 10x and have never been disappointed. The decor leaves a little to be desired, but the food makes up for it. The most epic meat fest...wear comfy pants

4VtkKPqalkHN0btCXhkqKQ.text: Went here with Regulars on Halloween for the first time and was impressed. Delicious parmasean crusted filet, ribeye steak, lobster mashed potatoes, sashimi salmon was still thawing but sushi was decent. Will be back.

xh18eZ0IT3DE2cpqgisOsQ.text: Meat, meat, meat, meat, meat. I think they also have a salad bar? Don't know what meat sweats are? Come here.  Good churrascaria... meat, meat, meat. Seriously, what else is there to say? As the last reviewer said - flip the card to green for meat, flip the card to red to stop. The food is freshly cooked, seasoned nicely and the servers come around often. It's not a place you'll often frequent because the bill is pretty steep because it's all-you-can-eat-meat! Meat.

396va0xRYe7fDhaShjr29w.text: You will be overwhelmed by the huge variety of sizzling meats flying by your table and landing on your plate.  It really IS as good as it looks and sounds.  The meat starts coming only after you've sampled the amazing appetizer bar- seafood, salads, soups, pastas, hot sides.  I would've been satisfied there, honestly!  And then BAM- its meat time.  Can't wait to go back, despite the hefty pricetag.

gLIp1vD5xQhl91JysGjP6g.text: Wide verity of choices from the Buffett.its worth the trip.all the meat was excellent.if u like ur meat. Rare, med., well, don't be afraid to ask ur paying good money. So get what u like the way u like it. Don't over eat enjoy the experience.i highly recommend.

UghbHmOTT3xxMAVECObVRQ.text: Went by last night for dinner with my son.  I had not been there in YEARS!    Let's talk about the good stuff first:    - the MEAT is magnificent, especially the beef tenderloin.  I did not go there for chicken, sausage or turkey, so I stuck with beef and lamb.   Each variety was done perfectly and spiced just right.     - the SERVICE was excellent.  The waitstaff kept our drink glasses filled and regularly offered "fresh" plates.   The meat servers were friendly and helpful in explaining the various cuts.     The mediocre:  - the BUFFET seemed tired and less-than-fresh.  Maybe it was because it was a Thursday night.  That's a possible reason but not an excuse.  We were paying $42 per person last night just like someone would on a weekend.   The food bowls were half-full, at best.  The lettuce was wilted.  The sushi tasted FAR too cold, which led us to believe that it had not been fresh that evening.  The vegetables were soft.  The shrimp was rubbery.  Not much in the way of salad condiments, either.   You would think that the owners would load up tons of great, fresh (and relatively inexpensive)  food on the buffet as a way for us to take up space in our stomachs.  The more we eat from the buffet, the less we consume of the expensive meat.  Oh well...  The poor:  - the DECOR isn't just dated, it's non-existent.  It feels like a cafeteria with the lights turned down low.  The chairs are institutional.  The tables are bare (but painted, I assume, in some kind of festive Brazilian folk style).  You're unable to get any sense of intimacy.  Nor does it feel "classy."   If they can't afford to go contemporary upscale, then go for Brazilian rustic.   - the DESSERT was awful.  Just plain awful.   My son ordered a piece of chocolate cake that came as dry and hard as drywall.   The icing had a thin layer of film on it that hinted to us that it'd been in the frig too long.       Ultimately, in spite of the great meat, we were disappointed.   I might have been LESS turned off had we not been charged $42/person plus the cost of drinks and dessert.  With taxes and tip -- and no alcohol, mind you -- I dropped $120 last night on this dinner.   I don't mind paying that kind of money for dinner for two, but I expect -- and get -- more for it.

t6wXcksZiw340lio1zGiwQ.text: The unlimited meat concept is not new, but they have mastered it. It is not somewhere I can visit regularly due to the distance, but I try to make it a special night out with friends when we can get together!

1xxo38XHQY62PFMGp-I0dw.text: Have been here several times and always have had a very good experience. The bacon wrapped filet is amazing as are the selections on the salad and bread bars.

lMEHnLxl1vyEqC1Fyi0k5w.text: What everyone else here says is about True - great food, superb service, location in an office park, decoration very plain. Would go again.

z0dchXri-dEfSWLxqNuDkQ.text: This was my first visit to this type of restaurant. Would I go back? Yes, in about a year when I can look at red meat again! All the meat was wonderful! They were seasoned to perfection and didnt need a sauce to go with it. The buffet had a large seclection. I loved the sushi with the strawberry on top. The service was great. My favorite thing was the grilled pineapple!

xJ2Gp-Hb102Mltc9xztkGA.text: Boy do I love going to this place. You gotta go hungry however. The meats are always wonderfully and plentiful. No longer a BYOB establishment, their wine selection was decent and not overpriced. We went on a Saturday night with 7:30 reservations. The place was packed and backed up heavily. I had to leave at a certain time and they accommodated us nicely. Although we go mainly for the meat parade we still touch on the buffet items to change it up a little. Oysters and sushi we actually pretty good. I highly recommend this place.

5Q4i9oyx7QvTzLGBSPkXXg.text: Flip to the green side up. Meat. Flip to the red side up. No meat. Their buffet appetizer is fantastic. I've never had lobster ravioli until I came here and it was actual lobster. I could have just eaten at the buffet but also did want some picanha's. The meat is cooked and seasoned very well.  They are now BYOB. They used to serve booze and we could get some caipirinha's and brazilian cerveja's but not anymore. This was my first experience at a Brazilian restaurant and I was hooked.   Now this place is no Fogo de Chao but it is still very good for what you can get in Pittsburgh. Plus, the bill is less than $30/person which is a steal considering how much food you can stuff down your gullet.

4RET7HYHHfQ_2m6ltssxIQ.text: all you can eat! there were over 10 different cuts of meats available. dessert is a separate price. the service is great. lots of options including sashimi and lobster mash potatoes in the self serve area. the servers walk around with endless and freshLy grilled meats. would definitely go back again!

N-s6TUjyeLyMu7VEYMdEJg.text: This place is amazing!  One price, all the food you desire.  Tons of variety, tastes, and great service!  I will definitely be back.

L52nQwhiSsMIdceNHPiTGQ.text: We went here for valentine's day, and it was great. We're new to the area and so this is our first time really going out. We moved here from cleveland, and there is a Brazilian steak house there that we absolutely loved, it was the perfect spot for a special occasion dinner. So since we found this place we decided we would give it a shot. When we parked and got in the place, it was extremely busy, as most places on valentine's day, but we were greeted within 30 seconds and told we could take a seat at a waiting table or the bar or on the couch while the tables cleared out. We were 10 minutes early for our reservation so this was fine. Within five minutes we were lead to our table and another waitress came over to show us how it worked, the drink menus, and to tell us about the salad bar. As soon as we got our plates, the meat started coming in. It was terrific. I tried every kind except for the lamb because I'm not a big fan. The staff was wonderful and informative and although it was busy, never once did I feel like we were waiting. My favorite part was that refills were consistent (we just had pepsi), and even when our cards were flipped to red, if a waiter noticed we didn't try the meet yet, he would still offer. The waitress who checked up on us and brought us drinks was just terrific. She was a sweet young lady that was so attentive and kind. She even took our picture for us. I will definitely be returning, and would recommend it to anyone!

N9iNHPoe11pjsOdHn7GDjg.text: Nonstop meat!  Fillet Mignon is awesome. So are the mussels. Try not to fill up on the salad party. Plantains and yucca are good too. Drinks are extremely strong

cq5MlZcxajfgeAFW7ERM-g.text: This restaurant is a hidden gem! The seafood was amazing but don't eat too much of it because once you flip your card to green your plate gets filled with delicious meat! The service couldn't be better.  You have to try the house drink, I don't remember what it's called but it was great! The cheesecake and passion fruit  cake were excellent . Overall a great meal and a ton of food, you won't leave with an empty stomach that's for sure.

zTlc5G77kI5j0aQncHILlw.text: Awesome!  Buffet of crab legs, shrimp, and many other things were great, but really were just  a sideshow to the meatfest that we enjoyed.  Staff was great, food was awesome and we left with full bellies.  A hidden gem in the Penn Hills area, we will be back!!!

6cVxZV25kZkrJenEw-oEkA.text: We're a family of four who have been to this restaurant twice now. The food is consistently good... some items are better than others, but everything is tasty. We go more for the experience than just the food. It is expensive, so your idea of value will depend on how much you eat. Recently we took my parents for a fun meal, so there were six of us, at $40 each. Not exactly pocket change. There was a family of three, parents and a young child, at a nearby table. The child was watching cartoons on an iPad with the volume high. I am the first to admit that it's frustrating for parents who want a nice dinner out and have to deal with a child at the same time. I get it, I do. Mine are 11 and 13 now. But I also wasn't in the mood to pay $40 per person for a special dinner and have to listen to the Looney Tunes at the same time. We asked management to please ask the parents to turn it down or use headphones. Instead of doing that, they moved the six of us to a back room, much farther from the buffet (which was not ideal for my father who is disabled). In order to have a non-cartoon accompanied meal, all six of us had to move our plates and glasses to another table. I was mortified that we had to do this and that I had to ask my parents to move shortly after we'd started our meal. If we'd gone to McDonalds I wouldn't have blinked an eye at the cartoons. But at a nice restaurant and for what we paid, I don't think it was professional of them to ask us to move. Asking the parents to turn it down wouldn't have been out of line or asking the much smaller group to move to the back. We couldn't have been the only customers not thrilled with the cartoons. We will not be returning.

151DWpyHHqBvslIdCTrxJw.text: Pros: Private parking lot, barbeque, buffet, hostess, service Cons: Be in Pittsburgh and not in Buffalo  Is it a good restaurant for kids? Yes Is it good choice for big groups? Yes  This is a past experience review. Around 7:30PM, the restaurant was not crowded and there were still available many sits there. The hostess was very friendly and nice and directed us to the table without any waiting time. The parking lot is shared with the other stores of the mall, but because it was night and most of the commerce around was closed, so we can say that was a "private" parking lot. The dining room was an excite place, really remembering a churrascaria on Rio de Janeiro. It made me feel home sick (what is good). The waitress was very nice and friendly and was always checking our table to see if we needed something more. Because this is a Brazilian barbeque place, my wife and I went there looking to eat a rodizio. Overall, the experience was fantastic! Because they know how to cut the meat on a Brazilian style and they offer Brazilian goodies to consume there too like Guarana or Brazilian coffee. After the dinner, I talked with the owners and found that they are Brazilians. So, if you are really looking for a place to have a real Brazilian barbeque experience around Pittsburgh, PA, this is the place. I'm still trying to find a good excuse to travel again to the city and eat there again!

VqLGlzqykEbYdu0mBkM2zQ.text: Decided on dinner here based on Yelp reviews. Our dinner included unlimited meats, the cold bar (salads, charcuterie, cold sides, breads), hot sides (lobster mashed potatoes, garlic-y shrimp and more I didn't get to).  All of the meats are amazing. All of them. We kept our cards green for a while so we didn't miss anything. But even when they were red, the guys still stopped by if something was a less circulated item (like the filet with Madeira mushroom sauce). Everyone that works there is wonderful. Our drinks were refilled before they were half empty.  We ate too much. Like way too much. But we weren't rushed. The options were delicious. And we'll be back next time we're in town.

LNix6QSpMr6IAp4psPyANQ.text: The Green Forest Brazilian Restaurant is a great special occasion choice. It is an all you can eat style with a variety of fabulous food. I believe they have over 16 or 17 meat selections alone. They also have a hot and cold buffet, which is an expansive area in addition to the meats served table side. Our gang referred to the service as "swords of meat".   The cold bar consists of many salads shrimp cocktail, oysters on the half shell, sushi and sashimi. The Portabella salad was delicious as well as the grilled asparagus.   On the hot buffet they have Lobster mashed potatoes and Paella.  \ For dessert we enjoyed the coconut flan and passion fruit mousse (when tried together was the perfect combination of sweet & tart) which were both good. There were many other options too. Please be aware that desserts may NOT be included in your special, so please check. They also have a well stocked bar. If you have a big appetite especially for meat, this is the certainly the place to go.  Check out their website for specials. I have also seen GROUPON specials from time to time too. On Tuesdays and Thursdays they have an early bird special from 4 - 6 PM: $37 instead of $42.50.  Service was attentive and pleasant. Also be aware that this restaurant is not visible from the main road (Rodi Rd), but it sits up in an office complex, conveniently located right off the parkway east, Penn Hills exit.
