RrSCLIslYRSNvTbjeQRxMg.text: If you wanna splurge and have a great night out, this is the place to do it. Their cold buffet has some amazing seafood choices. The fresh cut meats are amazing and their house specialty sirloin with mushroom wine sauce is to die for!!! Plus the service was excellent.

-0RLeOJ0xNhtaSHQ45Vcfw.text: Came here with some friends who have been speaking this restaurant's praises for a while. Green Forest is kind of hidden in the ground floor of an office building, but it made for easy parking.  Wait staff was excellent and very attentive. Had some lobster mashed potatoes, meat, and cheeses to start then got into the meats. They had a large variety of cuts of steak, lamb, chicken, and turkey. The parmesan-crusted sirloin was my favorite. The meats, even the parmesan-crusted ones, were all very moist and tender.  The restaurant facility is fairly plain but nicely kept. The only thing I can really ding the restaurant on is the restrooms, which appeared to be shared with other tenants in the building. They were OK but definitely weren't as clean as I would have liked, especially for a (high-priced) eatery.  This is a good celebration-type restaurant. I can't afford to eat here very often, but it's a nice option when you want to splurge.

6n0BFC15HFK3JQDrERYpug.text: Maybe I've been held hostage by Pittsburgh for too long (best major city I've been in - the food... not so much), but I've come to have a much higher regard for Green Forest. I've gone another half dozen or so times since the initial review due to the relative lack of good dining options in the city, and there's definitely a few really good points about it.  Food: The blandness of the grilled foods I spoke of in first review is highly variable, and I think I initially caught them on a bad night. If I were to estimate, I'd say that out of five random visits, one would be bland, three good, and one too salty. This odd diversity is distributed among the different cuts of meat offered, with the most variable being the leg of lamb, which has had entirely different flavors on different occasions.  And you know what? That's not a bad thing, given that I prefer to haunt restaurants I like rather than test a whole bunch of mediocre ones. I also appreciate the occasional change in salad bar offerings. I would say that on any given night, 85% of the offerings are fairly good-tasting, and that's enough, given that every dish being delicious to everyone is not a reasonable expectation.  Atmosphere: Actually, about as variable as the food. During busy nights, it's absolutely festive, with birthday cheer for all ages, young couples in the midst of impressing each other, and stout men in some form of informal meat eating contest. During slow times, it's quiet, though never quite gets to being truly intimate - probably because the number of servers dancing around the tables doesn't really allow it. Not really a problem, though.  Service: Very, very friendly, and generally very prompt.  Price: It stings. I'm still not convinced that it can't be done for cheaper, especially being in an unassuming outlying office building. This is where a star comes off, leaving the establishment at a four for me. I think if my red meat tastes ran beef rather than lamb, it'd probably remain at a five.  Is it possible that I'm starting to suffer some kind of strange Stockholm Syndrome from the dearth of restaurants to my tastes in Pittsburgh? Perhaps, but that doesn't change the fact that Green Forest has become one of only three restaurants in Pittsburgh that I visit on rotation. It's among the best that the Pittsburgh area has to offer.

SPI1bTFaxXQbgKDYpOSasw.text: We have been going to Green Forest yearly for 6 years now and they never disappoint. Never. Even though the price seems steep, when I think about all of the food we get there and what normal restaurants charge for a basic steak dinner... I would rather go to Green Forest hands down.   Not only do they have superb service but the food is plentiful, high quality and interesting. The large array of meats they present is vast and the spices and styles they infuse are just as numerous. It also seems endless because they are constantly rolling out new carts or spits of sizzling, freshly cooked meats that make your mouth water.    When you are overloaded with meat and need a break, there is the cold foods bar, hot sides bar and  the cheese/bread bar I always hit up. The cold bar has some of the best oysters, sushi and seafood salads I have ever had. Hot foods are more of a filler with rice,  potatoes and more...so as a small girl I ignore those. Cheese/Bread has at least 6 different high quality cheeses and the bread assortment is great and homemade.   Favorites for our last visit was the filet mignon with mushroom cabernet sauce, prime rib, parmesan encrusted filet, chimichurri top sirloin and the sushi. All time favorite is the sword fish with passion fruit sauce. Sushi there as mangos, strawberries and so many other abnormal but delicious accents that you will have to pace yourself.   They are more of a dinner place during the week and they have odd opening hours on the weekend but it gets busy after 7pm. Make sure you get a reservation and eat a lot of food the day before to streach your stomach...as my husband akways says. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Filet with mushroom cabernet sauce. So friggin good!
Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bread/Cheese bar

sK8ZINkE8tmTQO57hRMu-Q.text: My husband, being the meat eater that he is, suggested we try this place.  I being less of a meat enthusiast than he was a little skeptical, but wasn't disappointed in the least.  It's definitely a meat eaters paradise, but for don't be discouraged if meat isn't your thing, because there are plenty of other options as well.  It's the same concept as Texas de Brazil, only it's locally owned and it's less pricey.  You'll pay about $45 per person, but it's all you can eat and the food is very high quality, especially the meat dishes.  I did try 1 or 2, and they were very good.  My husband took advantage of just about everything they came around with, and he certainly was satisfied.  I will say, the buffet portion probably wouldn't satisfy everybody- it's not your typical "buffet food", but there certainly is a variety to choose from.    Our service was very good and she was very nice.  I mean, what else can I say?  That about sums it up.. we went for the food, but the good service was a bonus.  The location is a little odd, and is easy to miss if you aren't looking for it.  It's not a place you'll stop at because you see if from the road or drive by it multiple times.  It's located up on the hill away from the mail road, on the bottom floor of an office building.  I have driven Rodi Road hundreds of times, and I never even knew it was there.  I thought my gps had taken us to the wrong place, until we pulled into the parking lot.  So keep an eye out when you're driving there!

V_tHD3I_9aYUepdU2FVDKA.text: The service is extremely kind and friendly, much MUCH better than that of texas de brazil.   The fried bananas were amazing, I think I had three full plates of them myself.  I myself stuck to the salad bar, I gotta admit it was very nice. There was tons of variety, however, a lot of items were missing the night I came.  The sushi was limited, a day old and the sashimi had a frozen taste to it. Then again, who comes to a brazilian steakhouse for sushi, right?   I recommend this place, you can really get your money's worth.

tZToMfXUgg3E-g1_210_QA.text: Seeing as though Texas de Brazil is a rodent infested joint with awful service and hair in their food, Green Forest Churrascaria should be at the top of your list for date night, special celebrations, or pretty much any other reason you can think of.   The side dishes are not great - the cheese biscuits were rock hard and cold and the plantains were greasy - but you don't really need them at all. The seafood and salad bar is insane! It has raw, cooked, pickled, and fresh veg; sushi, shrimp, and lobster smashed potatoes; meats and cheeses; cold and warm salads; hot bar with soup, rice and beans, potatoes, etc. - generally, everything you need to accompany the symphony of meats.  Come hungry and ready to pace yourself, as every single meat I tasted -- from the sausages to the ribs to the steaks to the chops to the straight up slab bacon -- was 100% perfectly cooked and flavorful through and through. The servers were fast and courteous and made sure to stop by our table with each item that came out of the kitchen.  The wine list is small but curated and cocktails are strong. The dessert cart is everything you'd want for a post-meat coma: fruit tarts, chocolate mousse, flans and brulees, and usually a giant slice of some decadent cake.  Overall, Green Forest Churrascaria is worth every penny of what some would consider to be a pricey meal; however, I challenge you to compose this sort of extravagant meal on you own. Can't be done.

YzD2pHUHegnKrmvhpaIjPQ.text: The service is always incredible here. The food is outstanding. It is hard to try everything in the cold bar when the meat is coming at you so fast and furious, but anything I have tried has been fresh and tasted great. It was a fantastic date night meal with my wife!

62LTx7H-7A3wuL07BW22ZA.text: Pretty good food. I was there once for a "women's day" which discounted the usual buffet rate to $25. The restaurant needs some updating. The carpet is old and musty looking; the tables and chairs are old looking and somewhat uncomfortable to sit at too. I would probably only go back if they had that promo again. However I don't think that this place and/ or the food alone justifies the regular price alone which is around $40

OtIBr129mo3mpYHg7Y-Mew.text: Located in Penn Hills Green Forest Churrascaria was much better than I thought it would be.  Everyone was dressed business casual and the restaurant was busy but not full and loud.  We were seated and then our friendly server informed us how the restaurant worked.  It was a buffet of appetizers and sides and then you were to flip a card from red to green to have the servers bring you different selections of meat.    I started with the sides.  I skipped the salads although they looked tasty carbs were calling my name.  I choose to start with some sushi, cheese, lobster mashed potatoes and shrimp cocktail.  The sushi roll I had was topped with what appeared to be Frenches Onion straws and it was excellent.  Great flavor and perhaps not traditional (although I am not a sushi expert) it was the best I have ever had.  What was also wonderful was the lobster mashed potato.  When I scooped a spoonful onto my plate I was surprised to find and entire section of claw meat.  They definitely did not skimp on the lobster.    When we flipped to green and began getting our meat it was all very good.  My favorite was the filet.  I had it with bacon wrapped around it but I was more interested in the flier which was tender melt in your mouth.  Some things to keep in mind for next time....The meat was very salty.  I kind of got sick of it after a few rounds.  The potatoes although filled with lobster were also very saltily.  I am a big fan of salt but on the meat it was just too much.  Also the meat was always medium or close to rare a few times.  If you do not eat anything but well done this might not be the place for you.  I was just selective and tried to ask for an end piece but a few times I could not eat what they cut because it was just too red for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster mashed potatoes. Can you spot the claw?  So good!
Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brazilian cocktails

dskeAb--__DeVk1peEpIuQ.text: My bae and I went there in evening. It is a nice place with meat paradise!Tons of meat you can have as more as you want!The salad bar is actually a seafood bar....The dessert I had is chocolate mousse which is yummy!Overall I love it!We will come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

RFeX9sWToOke9tEh9OrwfA.text: Excellent food and lots of it! Most of the time, food quality suffers when so many options are available, but not at Green Forest. I loved the variety - everything from leg of lamb to bacon-wrapped turkey. The hot foods and salad bar were impressive too - lots of options and very clean.  The prices may seem a little higher than you're used to for a meal, but the amount and variety of food make it worth every penny!  Pro-tip: it's a little hard to find at night as it's in a small plaza without great signage...

qD3YAqRUtvUTYuy05JA52g.text: I have been to a few Brazilian Steakhouses in my time, but I have to say that the overall best experience that I have ever had at one was here at the Green Forest.   Is it a bit out of date looking? Is it in an obscure business park that you wouldn't know would house this place? The answers are both yes.  But the thing that is amazing about this place... Service, food taste, choices, and overall general experience.  What you lack in aesthetics, is made up for in great meat, friendly and helpful staff (they made sure they cooked meats well done on a separate little grill for our pregnant friend), and a generally great time. We counted at least 13 different meat options, there were probably more.  I think we actually ate 13.  The salad and hot bar has so much to choose from too.  And they have additional sides that you can get too (can you say cheesy bread balls and even French fries... Yes, fries... But I love all fries).  Only thing not included in the price is the beer and liquor, and desserts.  Seriously, the service here was amazing. I definitely recommend checking it out!!!

S7WvagKJsfdI2LgVtY5Aqw.text: Ok where to start?  This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh.  We have another Brazilian steakhouse called Texas de Brazil and while they serve decent food and have a bigger space, Green Forest has the superior quality food and service. I've brought dates, family, friends I even had my birthday dinner here before that's how much I like it. Literally everything they serve is delicious I can't decide what to recommend but one of my favorites was the bacon wrapped fillet. To. Die. For! Be prepared to spend a little money but it's worth it without question.

hHHChubRF5k7HMXctv5FVw.text: I came here with my old roommate for his birthday.  I figured we'd try something different than what is typically found around the city and he definitely likes to try the fancier things.  As my fiance is not a huge fan of meats, this was a great excuse to go with him.  This is my first and only Brazilian steakhouse experience, and it'll be very hard to top!  The restaurant is pretty easy to get to.  It's about a half a mile off the parkway and you can actually see the building as you get off the exit.  This steakhouse is an all you can eat one where someone walks around with skewers of meat to place on your plate.  They had 18 different varieties and we got to eat about 10 different kinds of meat.  It was wonderful, the amount given to you is just enough to keep you wanting more.  My favorite was a garlic steak and a Parmesan filet mignon.  Some of the meat can be a little rare depending on what cut you get.  They also have a  separate cold buffet portion  which includes cheeses, bread, sushi and shrimp, and some other specialty cold dishes. There is so much food lined up on the buffet it's hard to get to sample all of it in one visit.  The sushi was much better than expected, and I tried some various vegetable prepared dishes and they were wonderful as well.   Make sure you come hungry when you visit!  There is so much great food to try and don't be afraid you won't get enough steak.  The staff did a wonderful job consistently offering more meats so that your plate was never with it for long.  My roommate got a couple drinks for dinner as well and they were very reasonably priced.  Overall just a really cool experience and I have yet to see anything like this in the Pittsburgh area.  Would highly recommend this for a special occasion!

5dyJ-V1LJA8jIpl81MhQvQ.text: Bring an appitite..bottom line.  There were six of us guys that went to the Green Forest on a Tuesday night in May.  We had a reservation and were seated promptly.  We had the green buttons on go for the better part of the first hour we were there.  I only ate meat.  A few in my party ventured up to the seafood part of the restaurant.  Off the top of my head I ate: bacon wrapped turkey, rotisserie bacon, other bacon, prok, rotisserie chicken, sirloin, bacon wrapped filet, Parmesan filet, beef short ribs, siracchia chicken, ribeye, and a few other kinds of steak that had a special marinade that I can't remember but were tasty.  At the top of my list were the Parmesan filet, bacon wrapped turkey, and short ribs.  Totally full of flavor.  Most beef was cooked around medium or lower.  Some a little salty more than others.  We paid approximately 45.00 per person.  We ate solid for 75 minutes.  Meal and service was fantastic.  Dessert is not included.  I wouldn't come here weekly but when you do visit, it is quite worthwhile.  Keep up the good work.

kg2LfSaBhqJSnn_eV-FOpg.text: Wow!  Totally surprised by this one as the entrance/store front made me nervous upon arrival. Once inside, I was still worried as the decor is somewhat dated...and that's when you truly realize the old adage is True - you can't judge a book by its cover.  This place is a phenomenal churrascaria!  Over twenty varieties of meats, served gaucho-style with a certified, rock-star cold bar including sushi, various cold cuts and cheeses, salads, and more!  This place is certainly on par or better than ANY major Brazilian steakhouse I've ever been to in ANY major city around the US.   Come hungry and leave happy...with a belly full of meat. Truly delicious...just bring your appetite, take your time, and enjoy the variety.  Flavorful and plentiful food with super friendly service...sim, por favor!!

photos.caption: Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Unassuming front entrance...the &#34;treasure&#34; is inside :)

BGnJlHXWF8ZuNJb6yXXedA.text: My wonderful, loving boyfriend decided to surprise me during Pittsburgh's Restaurant Week with reservations to Green Forest last night (Thursday evening).  Such a supportive move knowing I started a very strict diet at the beginning of the week!!!  In any case, our experience here was great.  It wasn't very busy despite being Restaurant Week and a Thursday evening, but with the location, I'm not sure how packed it gets.  It's a strange location for such a place, but I am always a fan of restaurants that are off the beaten path (they're the best!).  We were promptly seated and everyone serving us was extremely friendly and polite.  The two men serving the meats were cordial and appropriate without being overbearing or too formal and our waiter took great care of us.  I decided to not get the meats because I figured I would have more than enough options with the three food bars.  The cold food bar included a lot of different salad mixes, sushi and other raw fish, plus vegetables. Everything I tried was really good.  The side bar had cured meats and cheeses. All were excellent.  The hot foods bar included rice and beans, a seafood in coconut, some type of chicken? dish and soup.  I only tried the seafood in coconut sauce and it was amazing.  It had was loaded with tender, fresh seafood in a Thai-style sauce making it more of a soup/stew.  I could have eaten that as my meal alone.  Bobby ended up ordering the full-service menu that included the meats ($35 for the week) and he had some REALLY good stuff.  Rotisserie chicken, parmesan filet, filet in a creamy mushroom sauce, top sirloin, skirt steak, some type of garlic roasted beef were some of his favorites and that didn't even include the things he didn't try like the lamb.  Everything looked really great and the servers remembered he preferred his meat more well done, so they made sure to circle back around to him for the end pieces.  I tried a couple small bites and everything was extremely flavorful and cooked perfectly.  My favorite, though, was the grilled pineapple!!  I do have one complaint, however...and that is that it was absolutely freezing inside the restaurant.  To the point where both of our hands were frozen and my nose was running.  And there is nothing I hate more than sitting in a cold restaurant.  We will have to make another trip here on a planned cheat day when I can really go to town with all the food goodness.  I just hope the heat it is warmer next time.  Very good little hidden spot. 5 stars!

pIuKpg3kg1neQQTupX8lEA.text: The Green Forest is a hidden gem. It's a great place for authentic Brazilian food. You can tell their meals are made with love. They serve the kind of food that can mend a broken heart.  Tip:Try coconut curry seafood over rice with traditional black beans.   Everything was fresh & savory. Excellent service at the table.   We'll definitely be back next time we visit the Pittsburgh area!

photos.caption: Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3mKGzsOqk_uSQz7LnHQhNg.text: If you like meat, then this is your meat lovers dream!  Been here about 10-15 times.  This is seriously the best place ever! Amazing meat and selection. Local owners, not a chain. 17 varieties of meat that they cut table side.  Always so fresh and perfectly seasoned. They always ask how you like your steak cooked. We love rare, so rare it is!  My kids love it here and beg is to take them!  Delicious a la carte desserts...the choc mousse is the best!  Amazing birthday special too and they participate in Pgh Restaurant Week!  Nothing bad to say about this place!  Definitely going again & again!

photos.caption: Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Picahna, done rare. Delicious seasoned top above the fat cap.

-OeW2B7MZeE-sNS9Km-tGA.text: We learned an important lesson today. Do not eat out at a restaurant on Fathers Day. Green Forest has been a favorite for our family, but our visit today was abysmal. We were a party of 3, with reservations for mid afternoon. We were seated quickly, and were greeted by a well picked over and sad salad bar. Many items were missing and not replenished, including the very important chimichurri sauce. Oh well. We'll just focus on the meats. We were seated in a room with a number of large parties. Over and over again, the servers brought skewers to the large parties and skipped our table entirely. We did not receive many of the selections, and the ones we did receive were the cold bits at the end of the skewers. When we asked a server for assistance, we were told they were understaffed and doing their best. Yikes. It's Fathers Day. In a restaurant that is all about grilled meat. At a cost close to $50 per person. Unbelievable. I don't understand why restaurants do not staff up for holidays, and why they accept reservations they cannot handle. We have been fans of Green Forest, but today was so off the charts bad, it will be a long time before we return. To be honest, we have had bad experiences on Mother's Day and Fathers Day at many Pittsburgh restaurants. It's a racket and we're done.

ngTSGykJvGtGcN4P5_UEGA.text: Always a great experience! So much better than the chain places. Service is top notch, food is top quality, and if you don't leave full, you have noone to blame but yourself.

D7HXhPh_c4SDSP-EpCdnfA.text: The service was fantastic, however for $45 it was totally not worth it. The cold and hot buffet had a lot of options however they were not very fresh. The oysters were very sub par and it had a "cheap buffet" vibe. I would say only 4 out of the 18 meats were memorable. The chatecurie board that's supposedly included in the price is actually just apart of the buffet and is just a couple different meats and cheeses. The cheeses that were included were hard and dried up. It was definitely a different experience but not nearly worth the almost $200 we spent.

dXMv1RwZvYYRGT0i0a2K1A.text: Hands down the best Rodizio I've ever had, and I've been to quite a few.  Every single cut of meat was flavorful and tasty.  Unreal.  The staff is SUPER friendly.  The owner runs around like she's on roller skates making sure you have a clean plate or a refill on water.  Just an outstanding experience.   I just wish I didn't live 5 hours away or I'd be here weekly.

2-jfeGTc5pJlRrq30K_Kew.text: LOVE IT HERE!  Vistied 3 birthdays out of the last five. They just get better and better.  The hostess/manager busted her butt in going the EXTRA mile in accommodating us and making sure we were not only satisfied but HAPPY--And we were.  The meats are succulent and delicious, service is spectacular. Green Forest is the first Brazilian bbq restaurant in the Pittsburgh area.  They offer an experience that Texas De Brazil and Fogo De Chao just can't match.  Whenever I'm feeling carnivorous (which is pretty often) I'll be here!

2UOz_0PrwJBbCIj5Yy8qhw.text: This restaurant is phenomenal, a meat eaters delight that even has enough options for the vegetarian to enjoy. The service is prompt and attentive and the buffet is extensive with hot and cold items. The price is steep but you get a lot of bang for your buck with the number of seafood items that are available. Cold meats, cheeses, shrimp cocktail, salad and other veggies compliment one of the best selections of freshly cooked meats you'll find anywhere. They also have something for everyone as far as how you like your meat cooked, from well to rare you won't be disappointed. I stopped by twice in the same week and enjoyed each experience as much as the last. I was also excited to see that the hot buffet has rotating menu items so there was no room for taste boredom. I need to give my wallet a rest before returning but it's definitely a visit that is worthwhile.

JYdYSxXC7jM4MqM8qcQIeQ.text: If you want as much as you possibly can eat and that tastes phenomenal this is the place to go. The food was amazing meat and seafood both. It's a little pricey, but for the amount of food you get its great. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday because he has been raving about this place for years. He loves it here!

g4ZjXOPc28wwpuxWUGF1ng.text: Hello meat! If you are a meat eater then you NEED to get to Green Forest Churrascaria. It's an endless parade of beef, pork, lamb, turkey, and bacon. If lighter far is more your thing, you can still enjoy a very filling salad bar, hot buffet, and cheese table. A member of our party has spent time in Brazil and was very pleased with the authentic dishes on offer. The staff were very friendly and totally on top of everything.  Of course the amount of food is staggering, and I'll need to do a mini-cleanse before coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

0XSvHn1YgIp8JsAKD1Z_rg.text: If your looking for different. Then look no further, good food great selection, romantic or comfortable atmosphere no matter the occasionn we've been here at different days and time with the service being phenomenal everytime. Not really for kids but if there into trying new things give it a shot. And the one set pricing theres no surprise of you get what you pay for!

6xn2RW77oFrb6bSRDFk63A.text: Went here for my boyfriends birthday. The service at this restaurant is really above and beyond. Every single staff member is attentive and extremely attentive. To begin the meal, we enjoyed the buffet area, which has some hot items, a charcuterie area, a seafood and salad bar. There were these grilled egg plant slices that were incredible. We both enjoyed a glass of red wine with our meal (14 Hands Merlot and a Brazilian Cab Franc) which paired nicely with the endless amounts of red meat. The staff does an excellent job at ensuring each cut they bring to your table is the correct temperature. All of the steaks we enjoyed were seasoned very well and had their own unique flavor profiles. The pace at which the meat is brought to you is consistent, you aren't really ever just sitting there waiting for food to come around. The Pao de Queijo (Brazilian cheese bread) is plentiful and delicious as well. We also had tiramisu for dessert, which was yummy. Overall this is an experience that warrants the price. Good food is important, but the service at this establishment is what really creates the experience. If you are looking for a unique dining experience, this is definitely a restaurant I would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

l8BXk33vWelcInhLW5yY3A.text: Another fantastic experience! We took my dad, niece and nephew here for their first time and they can't wait to go back. The food was delicious and service is top notch. It's hard to pick a favorite cut of meat, but the skirt steak, short ribs, and Parmesan filet are definitely ones to try. Everyone who works here makes you feel like family. The owners are wonderful and everyone made my dad feel extra special since we were celebrating his birthday. I can't recommend this place enough. Green Forest never disappoints!

0wYmi-k8zD3DUENP3-WoVQ.text: As soon as you walk in, the whole place smells like raw meat. Then you're crowded into a small table surrounded by other diners shoulder-to-shoulder. The buffet is large but you can tell the produce has been sitting in the fridge for multiple night and isn't fresh. And don't even get me started on the crazy lady manager that looks like a chicken without it's head running around the whole restaurant , even when they weren't busy, she still running back and forth , it made the experience uneasy.

q9QMBWw7dXmKEl53JKEO3w.text: Don't eat here! Meat bloody and fatty. No taste. If u miss the 80's nice decor! Go to Texas de Brazil if ur gonna eat! This place needs a major makeover food and surrounding area!!!

CtLi3XHgJRBB2bBvQWK7Rg.text: This place is great. I had been there previously  when it was under different ownership. I was a little apprehensive and hoped nothing changed this time around. It didn't, if anything the experience was better. Our waitress was very attentive and great at explaining the restaurant and our various options.   Also, the servers that come around to serve the various meats are fantastic. It is some of the most polite and helpful service I've experienced.

5OdFDFeJfztfEo0rwCVADQ.text: I believe this is the only Brazilian BBQ place in Pittsburgh (Texas de Brazil sucks.) Located just off 276, not very easy to find but you'll be fine with GPS.  Classy and nice, a lot of parking...  Great choice of meat, and the complimentary cheese breads + yucca fries are awesome... The latter is one of the best I've had.  Their orange sorbet (forgot the exact name) is awesome... Pretty much a frozen orange with sorbet in it.  Price is on the high end for sure... But that's pretty normal for Brazilian BBQ restaurants.

o-55W02yJKImVXJq7l9w8Q.text: Visiting Pittsburgh from Florida and this place didn't disappoint. The salad bar was great, the steak was delicious and the service was  excellent   Far exceeded my expectations

TexslZd4vtC8lsS_AaRtUw.text: Went here based on the generally very good reviews. We normally go to Texas de Brazil and wanted to compare the two. It's in a very strange location (an awkwardly located office park/complex) and kind of looks like a doctors office on the outside, and could be difficult to find at night.  First, Green Forest get 5 stars for service and friendliness. I cannot stress enough how great the entire staff was. Texas de Brazil's service is always very so-so and sometimes downright bad. Service is where Green Forest shines!  Since you're coming here for the meat, let's talk about that... The selection and variety at Green Forest is awesome and they are cooked extremely well. I always feel that Texas de Brazil is extremely salty and over seasoned and this isn't the case here. GF wins in this category.  The biggest disappointment at Green Forest were the sides. While not bad, they just weren't great and Texas de Brazil does it better. After pouring through yelp reviews and seeing all the pictures and reviews about lobster mashed potatoes, lobster rice, sushi, seafood salads etc, Green Forest had none of these items on our recent visit and instead had mediocre things such as plain rice, plain mashed potatoes, mushy over cooked shrimp and a few other items. Don't get me wrong, they were ok, but didn't come close to living up to our expectations. At more than $100 for dinner for two, the sides should be much more impressive (maybe they are on some nights?)  Overall, Green Forest is very good and the service is the best I've had at ANY restaurant and that goes a long way with me. Priced similarly to Texas de Brazil, perhaps we caught them on an off night, but If they would step it up on the sides Green Forest would be a real home run.

h8_XVJa7qXqJYTt-w9aAsw.text: Green forest is this nondescript restaurant in a nondescript building on a nondescript hill, just off Rodi Road in Penn Hills.  But like a geode, it's this lovely, expensive gem of a place that's totally worth the price of admission.  Why?  ...because THEY HAVE THE MEATS!!  Cow, pig, chicken, turkey, lamb, shrimp and lobster.  I see your Arby's commercials and I raise you unlimited rashers of slow-cooked tastiness fit for a king - if that king was a sharp-toothed T-Rex.  My first trip was the "amateur" side, but even that was impressive, with piles of lobster claws in (very little) rice, colossal shrimp, prosciutto, sopresetta and a full salad bar.  Next was the non-stop meat round and it was awesome.  Steaks, roasts, sausage, some phenomenal lamb chops, lots of items wrapped in bacon...  Funniest thing heard all day:  "Sir, would you like some rotisserie thick-cut bacon, fresh out of the flames?"  Why yes, yes I would!  #omnomnom  Service was excellent, food was awesome and the Only thing i would avoid is the bitter-tart passion fruit mousse (yecch!), which obliterated the nice meat mojo I had going at the end.  Other than that (and the whole nondescript thing), my meal was great as it was the last two times I was here.

photos.caption: Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The lobster rice is more lobster tan rice!!!  Mmm!

nNIhRLq5u3yUO9rwF6yqcA.text: By my count we now have three Brazilian steakhouse style restaurants in Pittsburgh, but this one is the OG. You're probably familiar with the general idea, but in case you're not, this is an all you can eat establishment. You pay a hefty but reasonable sum of money to sit down and then fresh cuts of meat brought directly to your table, somewhere in the vicinity of eighteen different varieties. And they keep coming until you tell them to stop. It's a fantastic concept. There's a salad bar with high quality side dishes available so you have something besides meat, and unlimited bread and other warm sides are included in your meal and brought to the table. You won't leave hungry.  I've never had any complaints about the service here, but your main server is just here to clear plates and bring drinks. You might want to consider a reservation with a large party or on the weekends. A standard selection of beer, wine, and spirits is available. The decor may be a little dated, but I promise you won't care. Remember, it's the OG.  I have yet to try the newest Brazilian steakhouse in Pittsburgh, but of the other two, this one is my favorite. The other one utilizes a cooking method with their meats involving rock salt to bring out the juiciness and flavor of the meats. I suppose it's effective in that regard, but the meat still comes out a little salty for my tastes. To my knowledge, Green Forest does not do this, and I prefer it that way. This is definitely a solid meal, and great for groups or special occasion dining.

Zpst8I0NB17sY8MMNXk4uA.text: Boyfriend took me here last week for birthday dinner. It was as good as I was expecting!  - The quality of all the food gets an A. The meat had good flavor and a wide selection of red meat was offered. They skillfully offered an array of cooking levels (well done to med rare). I only recall 1 chicken and 1 pork dish being offered, but that's fine...I preferred the reds. I especially enjoyed their Brazillian preparations; the Brazillian style sausage really surprised me. I was expecting regular old sausage and suspected they were simply affixing a Brazillian label to add appeal, but it really did taste different; not something I had ever had before. - The buffet area was equally as impressive. I really enjoyed being able to sample the traditional dishes like Tabouleh and Brazillian black beans. Seafood (shrimp, mussels, clams) quality was very good...hard to find good seafood. Liked the Charcuterie addition. - Loved the waitstaff & service here. Kind, attentive, thoughtful. - The only non-positive aspect that comes to mind was the atmosphere. The decor and layout were fine, food was well displayed, but there weren't many people there. Normally that is a plus for me, but the lack of people caused them to only light one room and gave a somewhat empty feel to the place. Our reservations were for 6 pm on a Friday, so maybe it was the early crowd. - This is a restaurant you want to be hungry for and to try everything you need to exercise patience  If you havent been, you need to go!

FbV84yX9x23HvXh5m7Yguw.text: The staff here is eager to please. I really appreciate how this cute restaurant is a mom and pop restaurant, unlike the other Brazilian steakhouses in the area. The fact that this is an independent restaurant makes me respect it more.   I personally think the meat at Green Forest is the best tasting compared to Fogo or Texas de Brazil. There's overall better cuts of meat and better flavor. I found that the other establishments I've been to, the meat has either been too salty or too cooked (chewy and burnt). One thing to note is shared appetizers such as fried plantains and cheese bread are not included and must be ordered separately. The cheese bread was not good, but still edible. It tasted like the bread might've been made with 95% tapioca and just a little bit of cheese. They did not serve plantains but did have fried bananas which definitely satisfied my need for some sweetness during my meal.   The dining room is a little dated in my opinion. The decor could definitely use an update. However, this minor setback did not scare away the customers. The dining room was still packed and lively, filled with many happy families and friends.   I would recommend this place if you are in the area. It's a little difficult to find because it is nestled on top of a hill. However, the service and quality of the meat is great! I left this restaurant satisfied.

A3CcMBW_tLMtdIFJ-sactg.text: Stopped by here for Pittsburgh restaurant week and it was so good!! Our server was so super nice and attentive to our needs. All of the restaurant staff were really talkative and we had a nice chat with everyone there. The place is small and intimate but I would choose this place over places like Fogo de Chao and Texas de Brazil, any day. It's just a totally different atmosphere and I loved it.   All of the cuts of meat were so good. They even had crispy pork belly, which was awesome! Most places don't serve different kinds of pork belly, in my experience. They also brought around fresh pieces of garlic bread the same way that they serve the meats and it was AWESOME. Everything was really good and I was told that they usually have sushi and sashimi which is what would make this place really stand out from other similar Brazilian steakhouses, but unfortunately they didn't have it. They only had smoked salmon and oysters out that night, but they were still really good. Their cold bar is probably smaller than others but everything was delicious and super fresh. My favorite was their corn...   All in all, I would definitely come here again, given the chance. Brazilian steakhouses are pretty pricey, so definitely come hungry and/or for a special occasion, but Green Forest is definitely a solid choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

TNfdyQvBIlutZWwZgIBbFg.text: Excellent dining experience for a great price! The meat is very good, and it arrives very fast. Huge selection of meats and you really can get your meat addiction satisfied here! Salad bar was very good as well, it included shrimp and oysters, which were very nice. Octopus was somewhat hard, but you don't go to a place like this for octopus... Great place to eat at, if you love Brazilian,  highly recommend, as i think it's better than Fogo.

ieOaE22VZO2msSFXKp3u_w.text: Went to try this as a alternative to Texas de Brazil. Roughly the same cost as above mentioned restaurant. When going to it was surprised it was in kind of a office industrial park. Not a bad thing but not what I expected.  Going in noticed it was kinda of plain. Not in your face with the decor. I more about food so that didn't bother me. The buffet seemed like it had a better selection of items then TDB. All on that was good. The meat selection I thought tasted better then TDB. The lamb was my favorite. Only a few things were off from what I expect. The thing about this restaurant that would really get me to return was the service. There were so many people who were checking in on us. Like it seemed every few minutes. Over all I liked the experience and if you care about the food and being treated well... come here. If you care about looks you will want TDB.

7VdDY5n4l_3Ejjm5oQqkAQ.text: This is now my no.1 fav restaurant in the country. Service 100% food 120% worth every penny. Meat is of very good quality and very well cooked. Salad bar smoked salmon is also 100. Fabulous experience both service wise and food wise. Definitely coming back.

E8iGc7tcEHH8q77Ek0zGug.text: Update: Green Forest has to be one of my favorite places in Pittsburgh for dinner !! Excellent service and superb grilled meats.  Absolutely highly recommend!!  They now offer three different choices on the menu.  1. Salad bar alone 2. Salad bar and hot foods  3. Salad bar and hot food with meats  I can't say enough about this place! Experience it for yourself !!! You won't be disappointed!!

Photo of Green Forest Churrascaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Purchase Meat Cooler

3bEp0mtQRqaOaj7pYpEWTQ.text: I was in town for business, by myself and decided to stop in for a visit.  I am glad I did, they totally took care of me.   This is owned by a Brazilian family that tries their hardest to give their patrons a True Churrascaria experience.   I was very impressed with everything - from their awesome, friendly servers to their food.  Food ---- I was all in.   The salad bar has some killing, ultra large oysters.   These oysters were terrific.   I was totally shocked how good and tasty they were.   I ate at least 10 - I came here for meat, but they were that good.  I also had about a dozen extra large shrimp, yummy.    The salad bar has warm food and I tried it all, it was okay, but I really was focused on the seafood.     The meats - I could not keep up.   I think there was 17 rounds.   Which means 17 different meats.   I focused on the Pecanha, Filet Mignon, Bacon wrapped Turkey and Pork Belly.  I am not sure if Pecanha and Rump Roast are the same, they differentiate here, both are excellent.   What I like with this place is that I can special order the cut, unlike some of the chain Churrascaria's which try to limit the higher end cuts from circulation on the floor.  Excellent service, excellent family run business, excellent meat!!!!   It is worth at least a visit.......

S_3HRujteqmhCY4zfRFOLA.text: They are amazing! The food is wonderful, and the employees are very friendly! Make sure you have an empty stomach when you go there. You will be stuffed!

uIRfu4SUtvBIrJXr93Euvw.text: Green Forest is one of my favorites. I went here twice on a special occasion and once for a birthday. This is the first Churrascaria I went too and it makes me want to try multiple other Brazilian steakhouses.  The first time I was there I assumed there was a dress code, but there wasn't. This does not mean you can come in sweat pants, good advice is to dress slightly better than normal. Or just ask your best mate... his advice is better than mine. Talking about your best mate you should tag him along as this place is way more enjoyable with over 4 people.   The food is pristine, there is usually around 16-20 fancy cuts going in rotation. An there wasn't a food that was carted around that i didn't like. my favorite being the Hanger steak with garlic, and the Brazilian sausage. The meat is 10/10 but it does't carry the restaurant single handedly as the fried bananas and salad bar are on the T.  I remember the servers being very nice also. I give this place a 9/10 and it makes me want to try all kinds of south American foods.

uALH429umJ5HemXEvb40hA.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our meal here! Great service, excellent salad bar including shrimp cocktail, prosciutto, asparagus, olives, and much more. Best Brazilian churrascarla we've been to. Great staffing and excellent food!

KwHnFn5Jj3z04_r680yltg.text: Very nice place that accommodated our large party on the same day. The meats came out piping hot each time and you were actually able to select the level of cooking you'd like (I.e. rare, medium rare, etc). A lot of times at other places they ask you, but it's all the same. The salad bar wasn't the largest, but the selection was very nice. Great service and, despite the odd location in my opinion, a very great experience. Would definitely go back.

ZBiFJG0OlY7FFkrBqnHOQg.text: Green Forest is located just off the parkway in an office building. We missed it the first time we looked. It's worth taking the time to find. The staff is friendly, the restaurant is comfortable, and the food is delicious. Plan to take some time and enjoy the variety of meats the staff will bring. The cold bar alone is worth you time, with a variety of vegetables and meats on it. The selection of meats offered at table is like nothing I've ever encountered. The wait staff will explain a little about each cut. Highly recommended.

9FGgorNUqwLE10Z-z1HW4Q.text: This place was awesome from start to finish! Had about a 45 minute wait for a party of 6 as a walk in on a Saturday but we sat at the bar, they gave us a few teasers of food to hold us over. Staff was very friendly and attentive and food was delicious. Make sure you're hungry because there's a lot of meat to try! Will definitely be going back.

GXrLFuqe24daO3xBb9cHRQ.text: Not ideal. There are only two Brazilian steakhouses in PGH and I think Texas de Brazil, although it is a chain, is miles better. I think because this is a smaller restaurant, they don't have as much turnover so the circulating steaks are way too tough and over cooked. I always ask for rare pieces, but the best they could do was medium rare. I also found all the steaks consistently lacking in the garlic taste that I expect from Brazilian BBQ. They really need to work on seasoning and cooking their meats properly.   The salad bar was also lacking in a variety of fresh greens. Unless they significantly drop their prices, I can't see why anybody would choose to come here. I encourage people to review the photos for this restaurant and gauge the doneness and dryness of the meat. Trust your eyes. Avoid coming here.

YZKeGviQPvKbmGKrdKHMnA.text: High quality meat and excellent buffet, perfection! From the waitress To the meal, service was amazing. Definitely coming back, worth the 2 hours drive!

M4C0-OLzfn4z-t6TikX4fQ.text: Food: Good. Meats were flavorful and sides were normal to good. The mash potatoes with mushrooms were excellent.  Service: Great. Everyone was very friendly and made sure we were satisfied and taken care of.  Overall: Good. If you're a meat lover, you'll enjoy this place. A little pricey but maybe worth it if you can eat!

31DhyE5CatlXXFX5EzxuJQ.text: Wonderful service, treated very well.  food is excellent.  Everything is fresh.  Atmosphere is inviting and friendly.

xVC2ZyJaKilhVjK0SOfibA.text: I've been to other Brazilian steakhouses so this concept was not new to me. You get a card that's green on one side and red on another. Green means go and red means stop. Waiters walk around with meat and whichever color you have exposed let's them know whether you want more or not.   I came to Green Forest during restaurant week hoping this would be one of my better experiences with Brazilian steakhouses. Unfortunately, I don't think they brought out everything since the meal was discounted. I read on other reviews all the seafood they usually have but unfortunately for me, there was none when I visited. What a bummer! The buffet selection was just meh and I didn't really enjoy any of it. The only thing I enjoyed was the meat, which I found everything to be well seasoned and perfectly prepared. However, there's only so much meat I can have in one sitting; I like to have more variety with my meals.   I doubt I will return to Green Forest even if their buffet is better. The price is a little steep at regular price and I know I would never get my money's worth.

g4P-ydsnzBQrdYNGvpRAAQ.text: 18 different kinds of meat carved table side?  How can you go wrong?! I had only been to a Churrascaria once before, so I don't have the experience with the style that some other reviewers must have.  I have to say, I was impressed. You start your meal with a buffet style area that has everything from sushi to rice, pasta, cheeses, soup, etc.  A lot of good options.  But a word to the wise - don't eat too much of the "buffet" area because you don't want to be too full for the meat! There are coasters in front of each diner, and as long as you have it flipped up to green, they will keep bringing you meat.  And meat.  And then some more meat.  About 10 meats in, I was puzzled about what other options could even exist and then they continued to bring more meat!  My favorites were the lamb, the bacon wrapped turkey and the flank steak.  All excellently flavored and juicy.  I wished I would have brought a note pad and kept track of what I was eating because it was honestly hard to remember what everything was.  They also had an amazing grilled pineapple.  I think I had more refills on that than I did any of the types of meat.  It was grilled with cinnamon sugar and was such a perfect treat.  (my mouth is watering right now thinking of it) I went with a Meet up group and can't wait to try it again with my fiance.  Yum!

tAFwEGqMLonA0ObIAtYdWA.text: The hospitality and service was excellent. Everyone there went above and beyond to ensure that we had a great dining experience. The quality of food, especially the hot/cold buffets and grilled meats, was excellent. We'll definitely return when we're in the neighborhood!!

PReplRj86y1Czrpjc8V5TA.text: The food was excellent. I had fried yucca and a new type of rice. I just wish that the meat was a little bit better cooked. But I really enjoyed the table side meat and the pork tenderloin and skirt steak. But there was a lot of people coming to our table so I never knew what I was eating. It was very amazing. So thank u to the Brazilian owners

VxtlU8snInvNpAeF6kIpew.text: Treated my boyfriend to dinner here and we had a delightful experience. Couldn't have been more impressed. The service was impeccable- everyone was so attentive and polite. The cold bar was delicious. We tasted the sushi, oysters, cheese and bread, and more. Everything was flavorful and also visibly appealing. The meats were perfectly cooked and so savory. The restaurant was beautiful and the attention to detail was apparent even in the bathroom. Overall we enjoyed everything about our dinner. Can't wait to return! Thank you for a wonderful experience!

SYhwsayq0e6QFYLFcH-LxQ.text: The food taste define perfection there. Deff worth the price. It was really empty when we got there. Actually we were the only people in the restaurant. The apatize's bar was amazing. They have this sushi topped with fruit (strawberry) couldn't have enough of it! Lamb is the best meat they have in my opinion. Service was great as well. Over all experience was great and worth it.

9gOWS5ajjuyv0AK18D7C3g.text: I had gone there with some expectation as I had heard some good things about the place. The salad and seafood buffet was actually quite good and honestly, by itself would have been great. (They offer the buffet only option at a discounted price) it was the grilled meats that left me underwhelmed. Several items were undercooked. The "gauchos" came and went without bothering to see if our order disc was red or green. There were times when we really wanted to enjoy our meal and they would not stop coming.

MXezTxGUColN4dk0IMUPmw.text: The meat tastes really good and various kinds of choices. They kept on walking around and giving out the meat like every 3 min, maybe it was because there were not so many people on Sunday for lunch, and also it made the restaurant very cold, I guess they though the cooking fire would warm the room :p I had to put on my jacket on while eating meat, which was suppose to make me warm.

-25S1y7Ng2pB_XevccXmkg.text: I have been to this place more than once and each time I am happy with both the service and the quality of the food.   I have been to many churrascaria and though I can't say that this is anywhere near the level of Fogo de Chao in Miami it is definitely good if you are in the mood for meat!  The husband and I were exhausted from all of the unpacking and both wanted meat!  We knew that meant a trip to Green Forest.  The salad bar has a decent selection and the hot foods even had a risotto of sorts with mushrooms that was good enough for me to go back for seconds.  The meats are delicious and they will bring you out the doneness that you prefer in my case rare to medium rare.  I tend to stick to the beef and the lamb, I tend to find the poultry overcooked and I don't eat anything that has been covered in Parmesan cheese (personal preference).  This time I also ordered a passion fruit caiprinha which was out of this world delicious.  These are too easy to drink and I made sure I only ordered the one.   Randomly the staff sang us happy birthday, because the waitress thought she overheard us talking about our birthday (we were talking about the wedding), but it was hilarious because the two of us didn't know what was going on!  Overall the service was great the food and drinks were top notch and we will return when in the mood for a meat orgy.  The price is not low but it is reasonable for the quality and quantity of food!

hX3Od5beUXZYedVVvMigrg.text: If this place was in a different location it would be the talk of the town.  Each time I was here they rotated at least 12 different meats.  These meats are high quality and tasty.  The buffet has items such as shrimp, salad, etc. which completes a tasty meal.  Try it out; it's unique for the area.

3EsF26_92CTceJwrBvVmdA.text: This place was amazing. We had a group of 8 and 2 of the 8 were little kids under 3. Now keep in mind we had things to keep them occupied, but the staff was great with them.  They showed things to the kids as they were serving meat.  The server we had was great.  She was very attentive.  The variety was decent but there wasn't Anthony that labeled g free. They talk about it online on the website but you can't tell.    The fish variety was great. We enjoyed the sushi and sashimi.    The only complaint I have is price. It's pricey.  I'm not sure 45 a person is really worth it.

FnFg8RorL3IHu12dXXZs8g.text: How can you go wrong with 18 different kinds of meat being served to you?  I had never been to a place like this before, but my fiance has.  He was equally impressed by his service.  I think he was also impressed with the price compared to other major cities where I bill may have been 25%-50% higher.  I liked the buffet opens because you did have a lot of "other" choices like salads, grains, potatoes.  Of course, your money is in the meat.  You name it, they have it.  I found the wait staff to be very personable and were good at explaining the "rules" of dining for those who were new.  (Generally, how to alert the servers if you are too full and need to wait for more meat.)    We definitely look forward to returning and are glad we found this place.

116EGk4klZkmPf6Tg8GP5w.text: We went here after searching for good restaurants on Yelp near our hotel. Parking is easy, but the restaurant is located in an industrial area; a bit disconcerting given the type of fare offered.  First impressions: well, the menu taped to the window had a very large scary beetle-thing stuck between it and the glass window. And there were little dead tiny moths stuck to the tape. I was a bit alarmed (because the beetle is so obvious when you walk up that the staff not noticing it was scary), but since we were there with no other options, we went inside.  The other reviews about the decor were spot-on: a bit plain, but the lighting was nice.   My husband really enjoyed the meats. He probably tried about 12 of them. The hot salad bar was not for me; I don't eat meat so nothing in there really appealed to me, and although I did try the whitefish in curry sauce, it was inedible IMO.  Now, the fresh salad bar was very good. Not excellent, mind you, but very good, especially considering the type of food I'd been eating on this trip for the last few days. Other reviewers talked about the freshness of the salad bar, and I would agree with them that this restaurant needs a little more patronage so that the fresh stuff gets eaten quickly and more fresh stuff brought in. I definitely had the impression that some of the food was set out, brought back in and refrigerated, set out again, etc. In CA, we have random health inspections that rate restaurants on these issues, but unfortunately, PA doesn't seem to have these inspections posted. I imagine if this restaurant were in CA, the health grade on it would be a B.   However, despite these concerns, we did still enjoy a very nice meal. The owner came over and talked with us and was super friendly and I could tell how much of her heart was invested in her restaurant.   If you have been to Texas de Brazil, do not expect this restaurant to come close to the quality of that restaurant. If Texas de Brazil is a 10, this place is a 7.5 or an 8. But they did an admirable job for the area, and I would probably come back if we are ever in the area again. The place was pretty empty last night, but it's been raining and it was later in the evening. I would love to see this place have a ton of patronage; I think that would improve the quality and feel of the place.

t1DKpuo4bQBalazkWKgvuw.text: Went there for dinner with my gf. A little bit pricy (40+ excl.tips) for casual dinner but definitely recommended for anniversaries. They grill a huge variety of meat including beef ribs, rib-eye, sausage, pork sirloin, garlic bread (my gf is a HUGE fan of it), etc. The meat is well-cooked and comes in big pieces as you order from the waiters who walks around tables holding a stick with grilled meat on it, and they will slice the amount you desire for you. I was unfortunate because they did not have beef *baby ribs* on that day, but the beef ribs are really flavorful, tender and juicy. They also have a small all-you-can-eat salad bar serving white shrimp, smoked salmon, portabella, sushi, tuna, etc. The hot food includes coconut fish (not so sure). The desserts come with extra charges. This place is located next to an exit of the freeway. Not very easy to find.

GsMGRzvICkPBW5U7AErewA.text: Great food, great salad bar! Loved the fact that they have sushi! The food was good, however the lamb was not cooked right. When you cut into lamb it should be bloody, when you bite into lamb it should not be dry. All of the other meat was cooked correctly. However the lamb was very dry!

w5FnBkULU09z4wDwqrqGdw.text: You will absolutely get your money's worth here! Don't let the 'all-you-can-eat' buffet sway you away from this place. The buffet is amazing in and of itself with items like, antipasta, crab legs, oysters, pasta salads, salad, mashed potatoes, different rice dishes, paella, black beans cooked with pork, Chilean sea bass, sushi, marinated olives, and different cheeses.   Each table also recieves a plateful of fried bananas, yucca, and tiny homemade rolls. Are you full yet?  Filp your red and green painted thread spool to the green side and the meat starts coming about every 2 minutes! Parmesan-crusted steak, ribeye, hangar steak, filet, filet wrapped in bacon, homemade sausages, turkey breast wrapped in bacon, lamb chops, leg of lamb, pork ribs....all brought to your table on a long sword-like skewer and sliced onto your plate.  If you have any room left, they also have an array of tropical-inspired desserts like passion fruit mousse, pineapple sorbet, and coconut tart.   Green Forest is no longer a BYOB. They have a full bar. We found this out by taking our own beer and wine this weekend. However, they were very nice about it and said since we did not know it was no longer BYOB, they would let us drink our wine and beer. There was a $3.50 per bottle opening fee.

FXXN3BMqF7AeSypa386DbA.text: Warning:  fast for at least a day before entering this establishment because you will want to try everything and unless you're an eating contest champ you will fail miserably.    We go to this restaurant at least once a year for special occasions (it is a bit on the pricey side and you must make a reservation or else you'll be waiting a long time to be sat).  The decor is a bit cheesy but it is located inside of an office building in Penn Hills so it's not going to look amazing.  The salad/seafood bar has AUCE oysters, shrimp, cheeses, salad, bread, and much more.  Attempt to resist the urge to fill up on those goodies because you need to try all of the meats.  They give you either a small piece of wood or coaster with a green and red side.  When you have it on green an employee will visit you and give you a piece of meat.  From sausage to prime their meats are great quality and delicious.  Remember to turn it red side up if you do not want any as a lot of their employees do not speak English very well and since they have so many tables to visit they will give you meat and bolt.    I highly recommend this place.  May not be 100% authentic but it is worth it all the same.

cLVlON2bCShaZiS-loMW4g.text: great place, good beer xyingu, good service, mango sorbet omg now all I need is a coupon

Fcbj3icuC5e47L9KacEUJQ.text: Easy to make reservations. Nice inside. Excellent meats. Nice staff members. Definitely would go back and would recommend to others! Definately eat the bacon wrapped filet, parm crusted filet, and the BBQ ribs. GLUTEN FREE OPTIONS

3jQcDM5qJaUNytC5w6Letw.text: WARNING: Severe food coma is a very real risk factor in dining at Green Forest.   It does everything it's supposed to do so what else to rate but 5-stars?  Clean. Endless food. Great and genuinely friendly service from the (I presume) owner all the way through the 'meat runners.'   Yes, perhaps being located in an office building and having a slightly dated interior throws some people off, but I'm not one of those. I'm coming to a restaurant to eat - I care about cleanliness, good service, and most of all - THE FOOD. You handle those 3, and I'm yours.   Great cold buffet to start....seafood, vegetables, Italian cold cuts, cheeses, ...I'd be happy just eating from this there are so many options.   As far as the meats, for me the highlights were the steaks. In the future I'd pass on the pork, turkey, and chicken. Probably the majority of the filet options as well. The one notable exception being the filet in mushroom wine sauce.   Lamb chops were also good.  But that flank steak? Whewwwww. Yeah, make sure you get some of that. The tenderloin, skirt, ribeye and other steaks cuts were all also very tasty. They were so much more flavorful than the filet I don't know why I would ever eat filet again.  Yes, it's pricey, but for an occasional indulgence or special occasion this place will definitely be in my future.   Enjoy.

qKFtqOcNCC5ZgXVyVtLIew.text: I have eaten at Brazilian steakhouses (e.g., Texas de Brazil, Fogo de Chao, and local restaurants) many, many times. Green Forest Churrascaria was good but is not my favorite. I did appreciate that they served some meats and other foods that some other restaurants do not serve. The waitress was nice and served our side dishes promptly.

jSe3DN4CltPYaZ3Xr-jIKA.text: Come here for the meat and with an extremely big appetite ... they have a lot of different varieties for you to try. How it works is similar to other places - red indicates "no more," green indicates "I'm game." Salad bar also isn't bad ... now if only the price weren't so high, but I guess that's to be expected with a place that serves meat that is from another country. Surprisingly, the sushi that they serve in their salad bar is actually quite decent

-Hp-Ggu4WvQck-76eVAS6w.text: I am so in love with this place! I call it The Meat Palace. I'm a carnivore, 100%, so there's nothing better than someone continually bringing me different meats. I prefer mine mid-rare, and everything comes out perfect. Also, absoluteeellly get the grilled pineapple (cinnamon I think). The staff is really friendly and attentive! I've worked in restaurants for years and I can tell you they keep that place CLEAN. Green Forest is one of my favorite places to eat!

82S9d7RKV_UNr-UyvaYBTw.text: Fantastic service, delicious food! The owners always make it a point to stop by your table & ensure you are having the best possible experience. A must try!!

NN8IB4tqdrZJ0Rk3GtPN-Q.text: Love it! Service was perfection! Our waitress Nicole was sweet, helpful and spot on perfect server. Flavia, an owner was more than helpful, nice, informative..... Food was exceptional. From all the varied and interesting selections in the salad bar, to the roaming meat servers. Grilled slab cut bacon, prime rib , beef and pork ribs, bacon wrapped filet,  rotisserie chicken, top sirloin, salmon (lots of salmon on salad bar too), beef tenderloin, etc.  We ran out of room before we could try everything. What a night! What a taste Fest!  Can't wait to return! (And I'm a picky bitch of an eater!!)

eEmKfDILTdGjvIgxoiRaGQ.text: This is a 4.5 star restaurant and like most Churrascaria is ideal for those with a hearty appetite. Many choices, including sushi.  Somewhat more low-key than the Churrascaria at Station Square with more seafood on the cold bar and at about the same price.   Allergy friendly with great service.

5wmzF7zzD01TXkEIUsmU1w.text: Green Forest is your traditional Churrascaria experience, on a smaller scale. The buffet offers a rotating variety of salads and cold dishes (a minor sushi offering, ussually just one or two simple rolls, crabs legs, shrimp cocktail, etc). Of course the real reason to go is the meat!   The selection varies slightly but has the usual mainstays, bacon wrapped turkey, flank or hanger Steak, (with or without garlic), lamb chops, leg of lamb, rib eye, skirt steak, top sirlon... These are brought to the table as long as you keep your placecard on the green side, often faster than I could keep up. (Not a complaint).   The waitstaff was attentive and knowledgeable. They responded well to special requests (we like our meat more on the rare side. They prepared a new top sirloin for us especially).   The only downside is that the deserts are nothing to write home about... then again, by the time desert comes around, at a place like this, who has room?

fKGZJkqf8nUJrFpFFc93Ug.text: I took my boyfriend here for his birthday as he is a big fan of Brazilian steakhouses and all the meat!  We made reservations for a Friday night on open table but it seemed to get more crowded later in the evening-after 7:30.  The service could not have been better from being seated quickly to our waiter explaining everything (my first time at a Brazilian steakhouse) to the meat runners-loved their outfits.  The beer prices are very reasonable and I got a draft Blue Moon for only $3.50.  My date tried the Brazilian  beer Xingu which was very dark in color but tasted like a lager.  Up first was the cold buffet which had a lot of seafood from shrimp to sushi as well as many kinds of salad including cesar, potato and pasta. . I enjoyed the meats cheese and bread spread.  I opted not to get the meat or hot bar included and that option was $22.50-very pricey for a salad bar and for $20 more you get the hot buffet with potatoes, rice etc and unlimited meat. The amount and variety of meat options is pretty amazing from a chicken leg to prime rib.  The meat is served medium rare but they will happily cook the meat to how you like it. The place was clean and the food all seemed very fresh. I highly recommend for a special occasion.

yCRO8Bd9p8xGBG2EX1knGQ.text: Today was our first time here and it was great. Our server Anthony was, in fact, "the shit" as promised by another Yelper. All the seafood was super fresh and the ribs were absolutely delicious. We will be back!

A8Db1KPW2ECcqmeT6JCJoQ.text: Amazing variety of everything. I really didn't think they would give you as much as they do but it's a constant barrage of meats coming at you. I tried things that I never would have otherwise and the staff is very attentive maybe overly attentive but that's not a bad thing. Recommend highly

YEwTTrmm8nQWj9dZ9HemuA.text: Meat coma, good.  Food, good...  Prices... pretty high but the food is totally worth it.

JLN49CzEK6Ki8Kcbw1aRnQ.text: My husband and I moved to Pittsburgh from Miami, FL a few months ago and I have really been missing latin influenced foods. Most of my review will focus on the latin aspect of this restaurant.   This is a very tradional type Churrascaria and reminded me of home. All of the meat was delicious and I definitely recommend going on a very empty stomach!  What I loved: White rice and beans - YUM!!! The beans were amazing, cooked with pork and so flavorful! Pan de Bono - Was part of the plate they placed on your table with various breads. This is basically a very fluffy roll with cheese cooked into the dough. Definitely the first place I have found in Pittsburgh that has it and it was amazing!! Fried yucca - Almost cried when I saw this sitting on our table! Yucca is a root vegetable, almost like a potato. Holy cow, first time I've had it since I moved here and it was cooked perfectly.  The service here was great. All the guys with the meat were friendly and came to the table one after another, so be sure to pace yourself!  The bill came to $102. We had: two prefix meals, one diet coke and one mojito. Pretty pricey, especially because I don't eat a lot, but it was right on par for the cost of any other Churrascaria I have been to!

EQbTmvlJn2XlNHdUGWcRyw.text: Gostoso! This is one of my favorite places to eat in Pittsburgh. I think it's less busy than it should be because so many people around here are so close minded about trying new things. Don't worry about if you like Brazilian food. If you like meat, you love it. If you don't, you don't!

jItfuss88ONjwsivlYES-w.text: I went to Green Forest for the first time in ten years. Amusingly, the last time I ate here was for High School Spanish Club. Grasp that concept. SPANISH club took us to a Brazilian (Portuguese-speaking) restaurant. Well done, Penn Hills.   At any rate, my latest visit was very pleasant. Sister and I went with a large group of people. We ordered drinks at the bar (which is a new addition to this restaurant). The  white sangria is some of the best I've ever had. Decent wine list, most of which are from South America. Don't try to order anything complicated, because the bartenders aren't that practiced yet, e.g. they had no idea what brandy was.   Now for the food. They have a prix fixe menu set (in 2012) at $42. This includes everything save dessert and drinks. Green Forest has a large cold bar with seafood, salad, vegetables, and cold cuts. A warning to those who do not like olives (like myself), they are mixed with many of the cold dishes (salad, potatoes, etc.). There is also a hot bar, which serves daily selections such as cooked rice and seasonal fish.  The Churrascaria ("barbecue" in Portuguese) dining experience is one everyone must try. At Green Forest, they give you a beer-mat type flipper. One side is red and the other is green.  When the green side is up, attentive waiters will flood to the tableside with many meat selections. My favorites were the filet mignon with parmesan and the leg of lamb. There are a little under twenty different selections of meats and all of them are very tasty.    A note; you CAN tell them how well-done you would like your selection. The waiter will simply give you a specific cut off the spit.   Once you are full, or simply want to take a break, flip over the bar mat to the red side and the steak parade will stop. As long as you want it to, that is!  Overall, staff is extremely friendly and attentive. Drinks and desserts are very expensive, so your bill can add up quickly if you don't stick to the prix fixe.

EUlUZ03XFlOQseAWusSi5A.text: Great time with the family on Fathers Day weekend.  The food and the service was exceptional.

sF-0IkotUzaxuXNy774Pmw.text: Going here for my bachelor party. Been here once before at another time and let me tell you, you'll get the meat sweats. It one of the best buffet places but you'll pay for it. It's a great place to enjoy meat. Totally worth your money!!

vrzb6nOkvNFaHgM78ur6Mg.text: First, don't let the outside appearance give you an ideas. Green forest is located in an office building so it gives off the wrong kind of attraction but once you're inside, it looks like a real restaurant again.  The food was just excellent! The salad bar and cold food bar is full of different kinds of food to eat.  After you sit down, the server keeps bringing different types of meat to the table and it was all good!

Y1jmlJoNHKPQi_XBtDIYZw.text: This place blew away our expectations. Thank you Yelpers for steering us away from Texas De Brazil and towards this place. The food was amazing (ok, the meat was amazing... The "salad bar" left something to be desired) but for a steakhouse, where the focus is on the steak, this place does it right. Meat coming from every direction it seemed at times. We counted 15 different types at 25+ instances of being offered (and our card was on red at times...) and 8 were phenomenal, 5 we'd definitely have again, and only 2 weren't to our liking. Take away - try EVERYTHING. Worth it :)

AzmBE9dDGEDLJjTTKftpnw.text: Excellent. The meats are perfectly done, and the buffet is fabulous. I'd go more often if it was just a bit less expensive. But you do get what you pay for. Love the place!

XPa7wCrB-EDreU8xC_CH5A.text: Amazingly delicious. If you've never been to a Churrascaria, it is a buffet where the "meat runners" come right to your table with meat on a skewer and slice off pieces right onto your plate. The steaks are so delicious you end up eating until you are about to burst. There are about 7 different types of steaks, and also chicken, turkey, sausage, lamb, etc. It is very expensive but worth going, especially if you can eat a lot. But any drinks, even a soda, cost extra. And dessert is extra as well, but I have never been able to eat dessert after all the steaks anyway! There is also a small regular buffet with some seafood and vegetables. But don't fill up on this, save room for all the meat! They don't open until 4pm.

L3nSoZf5fVG5UeECXp4YBA.text: A genuinely outstanding experience from start to finish.   Great staff, buffet including tomato and buffalo mozzarella, peeled shrimp, real Reggio Parmesan cheese (which I probably ate my body weight of), great cuts of meat seasoned and cooked to perfection.  Everything about this restaurant speaks of quality.  I look forward to coming back and highly recommend.
